MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Sharipa

texts.en:
Sharipa M. is 44 years old, widowed, and has three children. She started her business in cattle breeding with the initial capital of 15,000 KGS. She bought milk cows, whose milk she sold to her customers at the local market. She worked hard and managed to develop a farm with a monthly profit of 6,000 KGS. Sharipa ‘s family also began to cultivate kidney beans and perennial herbs on a plot of land. Using the revenues from selling the harvest, Sharipa paid for medical treatment for her daughter, who is handicapped. 

Sharipa plans to use this loan of 90,000 KGS to buy 10 sheep and one milk cow. She expects to increase the sales of milk and also acquire new customers. With the revenue from the loan, she plans to broaden her business.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Monsieur  Kossi  est marié et  père de  6 enfants.  Il est âgé de 41 ans et  habite  quartier  Hédzranawoé. Il exerce  comme  métier  la menuiserie  pour  pouvoir s’occuper  de  ses enfants.  Il a déjà  remboursé  un  crédit.  Il  compte  16 ans  dans  cette  activité et  achète les bois au  marché  d’adidobomé.  Il demande  un prêt  pour acheter  50 nouveaux bois.
texts.en: Mr. Kossi is married and the father of six. He is 41 year old and lives in the Hédzranawoé. He works as a carpenter in order to support his children. He has already repaid an earlier loan. He has 16 years of experience in this field and buys his wood at the Adidobome market. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase 50 pieces of new wood.

loans.use: Purchasing wood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase flour, wood, and other ingredients and supplies necessary for baking bread

loans.name: Tursun's Group

texts.en:
Tursun S. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Kochkor, a small village in Isykul region. She is 58 years old, married to a farmer, and has four adult children. In order to earn money the family breeds livestock. The youngest son lives in a sheep yard and takes care of livestock animals. With money received from the loan, Tursun wants to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future she plans to build a house in Bishkek for her older son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase all materials essential to her business

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is a 55-year-old, single mother of seven children living in her own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is responsible for taking care of her family, with the help of her older children. Her dream is to build a permanent house and to educate her children.

For five years she has been trading cattle. She explains that her start-up capital was from her own savings. She struggles to get a consistent supply of cattle. Her dream is to own a ranch. Jolly intends to use the loan proceeds that she is requesting to purchase cattle for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Monsieur  Komla  est  âgé de  35 ans.  Il  habite N’kafu. Il fait la vente de cartes  de  recharge.  Il  a commencé  son  activité  en  2008 et s’approvisionne  en gros  à la direction Togocel, Togo Telecom      et  Moov.   Ensuite il  redistribue  en  détail.  Pour satisfaire  beaucoup  de  clients,  il sollicite un crédit   pour se  réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Mr. Komla is 35 years old and lives in N’kafu. He sells mobile phone recharge cards. He started this activity in 2008 and gets his stocks wholesale directly from Togocel, Togo Telecom and Moov for resale at retail. In order to meet customer demand, he is seeking a loan to replenish his stocks.

loans.use: To buy recharge cards

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To improve and expand his business by purchasing additional spare motorcycle parts

loans.name: Folly  Koevi

texts.fr: Monsieur  Koevi  a   2 enfants  et  est   marié.   Il  a  42  ans et   habite  quartier  Hédzranawoé.   IL  vend  les  articles  scolaire  pour    faire  face  aux  besoins   de  ses   enfants.  Il  a débuté  son activité  en  2002  et  s’approvisionne  à  la  libraire  bon  pasteur.  Il revend  les articles dans une    boutique  à côté  de  la Radio Zephyr.  Il  demande  un prêt  pour  se  réapprovisionner et répondre  à la demande sans  cesse  croissante.
texts.en: Mr. Koevi is married and has 2 children. He is 42 years old and lives in the Hédzranawoé district. He sells school supplies in order to support his children. He launched his business in 2002. He stocks up at the Good Shepherd bookstore. He resells his wares in a store near the Radio Zephyr building. He is requesting a loan in order to replenish his stock and meet the ever growing customer demand

loans.use: Purchasing school supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking, 20-year-old man living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

For the past year he has been engaged in the business of trading coffee, beans, and maize. He explains that his business has been profitable despite challenges relating to price fluctuations. He dreams of establishing a food store, which would have a variety of foods and a milling machine. Joseph is seeking a loan in the amount of $425 to purchase additional beans, coffee, and maize for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza. In 2008, Ahmad opened his own electronics store in which he fixes and sells computers. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to increase the size of his store and buy cell phones for his store. He hopes that this will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To increase the size of his store and buy cell phones for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing for the spring season

loans.name: Mawuto  Adjovi

texts.fr: Madame  Adjovi  est  mère  d’un  enfant.   Agée  de  34 ans,  elle  est  revendeuse  de  produits  de beauté  et  savons  en gros.   En  effet  elle  s’approvisionne  en Côte d’Ivoire  et  redistribue  à son domicile à  Hédzranawoé.  Elle compte  2 ans dans cette  activité.  Elle  sollicite  un crédit  pour  acheter  10  cartons de  produits de  beauté  et  5  cartons  de  savons.
texts.en: Mrs. Adjovi is the mother of one child.  At age 34, she sells beauty products and soaps wholesale.  She gets her supplies in Ivory Coast and sells from her home in Hédzranawoé.  She has been doing this work for 2 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy 10 cartons of beauty products and 5 cartons of soap.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and soap

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata S. is a 35-year-old small scale businesswoman who lives in Mile Ninety One, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. Aminata sells rice and drinks from her store. She has been working in this business for 10 years now. With the requested loan of SLL 3,000,000, she plans to buy more rice and drinks wholesale to grow her business.

Aminata is a native of Matotoka village. She is married to a lorry driver and the couple has 3 children – 1 in primary school and the others in secondary school. She is the first Kiva borrower from this township.

loans.use: To purchase more rice and drinks to grow her business

loans.name: Peninah Wanza

texts.en:
Penina buys and rears livestock to sell later at a profit. She does this on her own plot of land. She has been in this business for the last four years and earns an income of KES 2,000 per month. Penina is 46 years old, married and supports six members of her family. 

She learned about Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, from a member of another registered group and she has never borrowed from any other MFI. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, with which she plans to buy two goats for fattening and later selling. Penina intends to use the anticipated profits to cover her family's basic needs and save. In the future she hopes to become the leading livestock keeper.

loans.use: To buy two goats for fattening and selling later at a profit

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en: J. is currently in the business of selling simsim (sesame seed) paste. She is 40 years old and married to a church leader, with 8 children who all go to school. J. is requesting this loan to increase her stock of simsim paste for sale. In the future, J. hopes to open a hotel with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To purchase more simsim paste for resale

loans.name: Moses  Muatha

texts.en:
Moses M. is 57 years old and married to Lonadi, who helps in the farm. He supports six members of his family. He has been in business for one year with an income of KES 5,000 per month. 

This is his first loan from Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, and he intends to use it to buy two goats and sheep for fattening, which he will later sell at a profit. He hopes to improve his family's standard of living and be a leading livestock trader in the area.

loans.use: To buy two goats and sheep for fattening and selling later at a profit

loans.name: Titus Mburu

texts.en:
Titus is a 26-year-old single man. He has a motorbike which he uses for a transport service for the people of Kabati Thika. He has been in the business for a period of about one year now with an income of 5,300 Kenyan shillings per month.

Titus has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he is applying for his first loan from KADET, which he intends to use to buy an extra motorbike. He hopes to expand his transport business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy an extra motorbike

loans.name: Mylene Faith

texts.en: To make a living, Mylene Faith J. plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. She is 25 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of San Juan Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Mylene Faith is just starting her business. In 2009, Mylene Faith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Mylene Faith is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie S.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. He is 37 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. They are from the village of Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Julie has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Julie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Julie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Julie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Arastun

texts.ru: Arastun I. 28 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Arastun yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda , seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Arastun uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji ovoshi i fruktov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo druqa. Arastun seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit frukti i ovoshi dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Arastun I. is 28 years old.  He is single and childless.  Arastun is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his parents. Arastun has been selling fruit and vegetables for two years.  He started this business with his friend.  Arastun now needs 2300 AZN to buy fruit and vegetables for resale in order to expand his business.

loans.use: buy fruit and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Charity

texts.fr: Dame  charity  a  39 ans  et  mère  de  6 enfants.   Elle  habite  quartier  Hédzranawoé.  Elle  fait  le commerce    de tubercules.  Elle  a  commencé  son  activité  en  2008 et  s’approvisionne  à  Atakpamé.  Elle  revend  au  marché  local  de Hédzranawoé.   Elle demande  un  prêt  pour  acheter  10 tas  d’igname.
texts.en: Charity is 39 years old and mother to six children. She lives in the Hédzranawoé district. She trades in tubers. She began her activity in 2008 and gets her supplies in Atakpamé. She resells her products at the local market in Hédzranawoé. She is requesting a loan to buy ten piles of yams.

loans.use: Purchase of yams

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason B. is from the village of Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. He is 32 years old. Jason is single and has one young child. Jason owns and operates a business raising crabs for sale. Jason has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 6,830 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2008, Jason joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jason has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby crabs to raise and sell. Jason is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase crab feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jason from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is a 33-year-old married man with four children and llves in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely responsible for looking after his children and his dream is to educate them up to university level. For eight years Geofrey has been operating a retail shop. He faces minimal hardships in his business, such as high rental costs. Geofrey is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
Antonio en su bicicleta acondicionada para vender sus papa fritas recorre el municipio de Barbosa y de esta forma consigue diariamente el sustento para su familia.

Sin embargo, Antonio necesita comprar mas insumos para poder tener mas cantidad de producto para venderla, ya que al tener mayor número de clientes su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos mejorará notablemente.
texts.en: Antonio has his bicycle set up to sell french fries on the streets of the municipality of Barbosa, and in this way he makes a living to provide for his family. However, Antonio needs to purchase more ingredients in order to sell his product in larger quantities, since having a larger number of customers will notably improve the quality of life for himself and his children.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: O. is 48 years old, married to a soldier and has five children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling goods from a shop. O. has requested a loan to stock more goods to sell in her shop. In the future, she hopes to buy a grinding machine with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell in her shop

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad P. is from the village of Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 55 years old, widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Solidad owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Solidad has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Solidad joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Solidad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco L. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. He is 60 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Francisco owns and operates a business venture operating tricycle transport services. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Francisco joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to offer a better service. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. Francisco plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle in order to offer better services

loans.name: Twaibu

texts.en: Twaibu is a 27-year-old married man with two children and lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his family and he has a dream of building a permanent house for them to live in. He has worked in the agricultural sector for seven years and his work has been very profitable to him despite seasonal challenges. Twaibu is requesting a loan to buy maize for planting maize.

loans.use: Preparation of land for maize growing.

loans.name: Lucy Wangeci

texts.en:
Lucy G. is 40 years old and married to Peter Macharia, who also contributes to the family income. She has two children aged seven and three years old.

Lucy has been running her mobile monetary transfer, locally known as a Mpesa shop, for a period of three years, making an income of approximately KES 19,200 per month.

This is her fifth loan after successfully repaying the previous loans in full and in good time. She hopes to give her children a quality education, improve her family's living standard and hopefully start her own bank in the future.

loans.use: To open another mobile monetary transfer (Mpesa) shop.

loans.name: Faïmaguebé

texts.fr: Dame  Faïmoguebé   est  mariée  avec  2 enfants   à  charge.   Elle   fait   le  commerce  de  céréales.  Elle  compte  15  ans   dans  cette  activité  et  s’approvisionne     au  Nord  du Togo à  Dapaong.  Après, elle  revend  au  marché  local  de Hedzranawoé.   Elle  sollicite un  crédit  pour  acheter  5 sacs  de maïs,  3  sacs  d’haricot,  2 sacs  de mil  et 2 sacs de sorgho.
texts.en: Faïmaguebé is married with two children in her care. She trades in cereals. She has 15 years experience of this business and gets her supplies in Dapaong in the north of Togo. Afterwards she resells her products at the local market in Hedzranawoé. She is requesting a loan to buy five sacks of corn, three sacks of beans, two sacks of millet and two sacks of sorghum.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn D. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 51 years old. Marilyn is married and has one grown up child.

To make a living Marilyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as noodles, sugar, milk, coffee, rice, bagoong (a fish-based condiment), dried fish, shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Marilyn is just starting this business.

In 2008 Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.

She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits and to repair the store for the expansion  of the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits and to repair the store

loans.name: Sarapio

texts.en:
Sarapio is a sixty-year-old married man with thirteen children, living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

For six years he has been operating a clinic and with the income generated he was able to start up a lodge. His future plan is to build a hotel.

Sarapio needs this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela A. is from the Malaubang district (barangay) of Ozamiz City. She is 61 years old. Pamela is widowed and has two grown up children. To make a living Pamela owns and operates a business in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling banana cue (a caramelized banana dessert). Pamela has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011 Pamela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Pamela is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pamela from GDMPC. Pamela plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. loans.name: Sharafat

texts.ru: Sharafat F. 50 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v kolledje. Sharafat yavlyayetsya IDP personom, ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmetse so svoyey drujnoy i lubimoy semyoy. Sharafat uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji kosmetiki,duxi i t.d. Seychas Sharafat nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye svoyeqo magazina dlya toqo chtob pomestit bolshe tovarov.
texts.en: Sharafat F. is fifty years old.  She is married and has two children who go to college.  .  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with close, beloved family. Sharafat has been selling cosmetics, perfume, etc. for seven years now.  Currently, Sharafat needs 2300 AZN to expand her shop in order to offer more products.

loans.use: expand the shop

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 57-year-old Memuna T.. She is married and has two children. Both of them are adults.

Memuna T. owns a clothing business. Memuna’s friend inspired her to start this type of business. Over the years Memuna’s business has grown more successful. She opens her business seven days a week and eight hours a day.

Memuna would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,800,000 in order to do repairs to her shop and to buy more clothing for resale.

In the future Memuna aspires to become a supplier to other textile dealers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor Q. is from Aguada, Ozamiz City. He is 43 years old. Nestor is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nestor owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing photocopying services in the local community. Nestor has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2007 Nestor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Nestor is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase bond papers, ink and to repair existing machine for better services of his business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nestor from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
Ngwa F. is married and a mother of seven children, four of them below the age of 15. Faced with the challenges of working hand in hand with her husband to take care of their kids, she finds it difficult to sponsor their education.  Due to her own lack of education, she could not secure a good job, so she embarked on farming.  
  
Unfortunately, she was not familiar with farming methods that could improve her output.  As a member of GHAPE, she was fortunate to acquire some techniques that have helped her improve on her farming and marketing strategies.

Ngwa F. has been successful at managing and paying back her previous loans.  With a new loan, she plans to invest it in farming and the selling of vegetable, garri (also known as tapioca), yams and potatoes.

Her activities will help her community, as she will be able to supply the market with basic foodstuff. She will plow her profit back into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children;s school fees, and will save some for rainy days. Ngwa F. prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the instalmental method paying back the loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multifaceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To invest in seeds, yams, potatoes and garri

James says he inherited this business from his late parents who were commercial farmers. He says he is going to purchase fertilizers for his farming gardens with this loan.

loans.name: Amabo

texts.en: Amabo J. N. was born in 1942 and is married to Ngum Helen. They are blessed with eight children. Two of their children are below the age of 15. He occupies 7 rooms with his 8 children in the Ntagem quarter of Nkwen Bamenda, Cameroon. J. has faced a lot of problems in his life ranging from the death of his pigs and piglets, the inability to raise capital to start a business, and seizure of land by some kingmakers (local officials), just to name a few. Motivated by another member of GHAPE, he became a member in April 2003 and has successfully borrowed and repaid loans 5 times. Having been given another loan, he plans to purchase piglets and feed, firewood and fruit for retail. His business is going to help the people of his community by supplying them constantly and on a daily basis with pork meat. The local availability of firewood and fruit all the time will reduce the distance to the market by the people of his community. He is convinced that his business is going to be successful because he has experience in doing this business and the demand for firewood and pork meat is very high in his community. His business is located by the road side. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets, firewood, fruit, and pig feed

loans.name: Sihambise Kahle Group

texts.en:
Witness is 62 years old and married with four children, ages 9, 16, 22 and 39, three of whom are still attending school. She also takes care of two other relatives who also live with her. Her husband works as a chief secretary. In the photo above, she is standing in front of her group wearing a white shirt. 

She sells live chickens and soft drinks from her home in Mandini and has been in this business for over five years. She also earns income from the government’s child support grant as well as the old age grant. She says that the main challenge to her business is that the customers buy on credit and fail to pay on time.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Business and KIVA to buy more soft drinks and live chickens to sell. In five years time she would like to own a big shop and build a house for the orphans around her place. She says that the extra income from this loan will pay for the school fees and send her children for further education.
 
Witness thanks WDB and Kiva for lending her the money, and she hopes WDB And KIVA will stay for a long time.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: H. is currently in a business of selling beer, soda and water. She is 34 years old and a widow, with two children who both go to school. H. took out a loan to stock more beer, soda and water to sell. In the future she hopes to buy cattle and open up a shop with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more beer, soda and water.

loans.name: Gedion Maina

texts.en:
Gideon is 48 years old. He supports four members of his family. He is married to Patricia and they are blessed with three children, ages 20, 16 and 10. Gideon’s wife provides outside catering services which is an extra source of income. 

He has been operating a retail shop for the past thirty-one years. His monthly income is approximately $227. He plans to use the entire loan amount to increase his stock of maize flour and sugar. 

Gideon will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his three children. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD. His hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To increase stock of maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Leila Rosa

texts.es: Leila Rosa se dedica a una pulpería, en la que ofrece una gran variedad de productos. Tiene más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a solicitar diferentes productos que son necesarios para hogar. Inicio este medio de vida para fondos propios, ya que necesitaba mantener a sus 3 hijos y así proporcionarle lo necesario. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, pan, galletas, juegos, gaseosas y granos básicos.
texts.en: Leila Rosa has a convenience store where she sells a wide variety of products. She has had this business for more than 8 years. The majority of her customers always ask for different products they need for their homes. She began her business with her own savings, as she needed to support her 3 children and provide what they need. The loan will be used to buy candy, bread, cookies, toys, soda pop and basic grains.

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Dehiya

texts.en: A. is currently in a business of selling wax, saddles and body lotions. She is 34 years old, married to a mechanic, has two children and all of them go to school. A. borrowed a loan to stock more wax, saddles and body lotions. In the future, she hopes to open a big shop with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more wax, saddles and body lotions.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Born in 1978, Kang D. is married to Che Emmanuel and has five children. She has been very hardworking from the day she joined GHAPE. Her desire is to work for her children’s education and pay for their school fees so that they can be educated. She decided to become a member of GHAPE due to her inability to get investment capital that could give her higher income to meet her children’s needs and the family's needs. 

With this loan, she plans to buy piglets and feed. This investment will help people in her community to have pork. She also wants to invest part of the loan toward purchasing a farm to start the growing of vegetables. 

She is planning to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school. She will plow her profit back into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children's school fees, and she will save some for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost of obtaining and paying back the loan.

About GHAPE:
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: piglets, feed, farm tools

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina Del Carmen tiene 48 años. Su actividad económica es una panadería. Hace más de 6 años que inicio esta actividad ya que por medio de sus hijos ella decide incursionar en este negocio, pues es muy rentable y Maria estaba interesada en aprender este negocio. Su familia brinda el apoyo necesario en este negocio y así fue como unidos salieron adelante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla entre otros productos necesarios.  Para un futuro le gustaría seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que salgan adelante.
texts.en: Marina Del Carmen is 48 years old. Her business is a bakery. It has been more than 6 years since she began this business as she decided to invest in it through her children as it is very profitable and Maria was interested in learning this business. Her family provides the necessary support in this business and by working together have been successful. The loan will be used to buy flour, eggs, butter, and other needed products. In the future she would like to continue supporting her children so that they will be successful and able to get ahead in life.

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina V. lives in the Alvank community in the Meghri region of Armenia. She lives with her husband and daughter. Her son is currently serving in the Army. She works as an operator in the local post office. 

To bring additional income to her household, Angelina has been running a small farm for eight years. Her husband is unemployed and helps Angelina in their farming business. They sell the milk and meat products to the nearby markets. 

Taking into consideration the rising demand for cattle, Angelina is planning buy cattle. Having insufficient funds to invest in their business, Angelina has applied to SEF for a loan to expand their business and increase the household’s income.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Guillermina Doris

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; la socia tiene 46 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia tiene su negocio de venta de materiales de construcción ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo llevan ya un buen tiempo en este negocio, a la vez la socia es docente del nivel primario ella trabaja por el centro de la ciudad estas dos actividades son la forma que ella tiene para sacar  a su familia adelante ya que su familia son el motivo que ella tiene para seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para la venta de su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is Mrs. Guillermina; she is 46 years old, married, and has 2 children; she has a business selling construction materials. She works along with her husband, and they work well together. She is also an elementary teacher in the center of the city. These two activities are the manner in which she supports her family and it is her family that is the motive that she has to be successful.

The member seeks a loan to buy more merchandise to sell in her business.

The member is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram G. lives in Sisian together with his mother, wife and his student daughter who is currently studying in the Agricultural University. Taking into consideration the special local climate conditions, it is more feasible to be engaged mostly in farming and then land cultivation. 

Aram is very positive and energetic. He decided to expand both his family and his business. He has applied for the loan to increase the number of cattle and prepare the land for cultivation. The business expansion should bring additional income to his family and serve as a good basis for his family expansion. Aram and his wife want to have more children.

loans.use: To increase his number of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction on her home

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es: Sonia Del Socorro tiene 64 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años que inicio esta actividad, incursiona en este negocio después que se jubila inicio vendiendo pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas y tratamientos a Sonia le ayudo mucho porque tiene ciertos conocimientos de cosméticos y los brinda como consejos a sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cremas, perfumes, pinturas de labios y pinturas de uñas.
texts.en:
Sonia Del Socorro is 64 years old.  She has been selling cosmetics for the last four years.  She moved into this business when she retired.  She started off selling lipstick, nail polish, and creams.  This helped Sonia a lot because she has some knowledge of cosmetics and was able to offer her clients advice.  

The loan she is requesting is for the working capital to buy creams, perfumes, lipstick, and nail polish.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Iliana

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Iliana; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche entre otros su tienda se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa ella lo abre desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:0pm también vende otros  productos como golosinas,gaseosas,fideos,aceite entre otros, la socia a la vez vende tickets de bus a la ciudad de Puno, Arequipa y Puerto Maldonado ella tiene un stand en el terminal terrestre de Cusco ,la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes y así poder tener mas variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is Mrs. Iliana.  She is 42 years old, married and has two children.  She owns a grocery store where she sells essential items like rice, sugar and milk, among others.  Her store is located in her house.  She is open from 6:00am until 9:00pm.  She also sells other products like snacks, sodas, pastas, oil, etc.  At the same time, she also sells bus tickets to Puno, Arequipa and Puerto Maldonado.  She has a stand in the bus terminal in Cusco.  She is a very happy person with a lot of desire to move forward. 

She asks for the loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store so that she can offer her customers greater variety.  

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her grocery store and be able to offer her customers more variety

loans.name: Arnol

texts.es: Arnol, de 35 años. Vive en concubinato con Rosa con quien tiene 2 hijos, a los cuales cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de guacamayo (selva central peruana). Hace 13 años que se dedica a la siembra de cítricos y café. Los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y dedicación, tanto así que en campaña agrícola que dura una vez al año, los mismo comerciantes mayoristas visitan sus chacras para comprar su cosecha entera. Durante todo este año logró obtener 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Ahora desea mejorar su producción de plátanos para poder obtener mejores ganancias cada 15 días, puesto que es el tiempo que demora para la maduración. Él pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es uno de los socios más entusiastas. Arnol, invertirá el crédito que solicita, en la contrata de personal para que le ayude en la limpieza de sus plantas de cítricos y café.
texts.en:
Arnol, 35 years old, lives with his partner Rosa with whom he has 2 children.  They care for the children in their own home, which is located in the community of Guacamayo (central Peruvian forest).  For 13 years he has planted citrus and coffee, which he cares for with a great thoroughness and dedication, so much so that during the yearly farming season the same wholesalers visit his farm to buy his entire harvest.  During this whole year he was able to get 2 hectares of farmland.  Now he wants to improve his plantain production in order to increase his income every 15 days - the time it takes for plantains to ripen.  

He belongs to the village bank "Nuevo Amanecer de Guacamayo" and this is his first loan with MFP, where he is one of the most enthusiastic members.  Arnol will invest the loan in hiring someone to help him prune the citrus and coffee plants.

loans.use: Hire someone to help prune coffee and citrus plantations

loans.name: Karapet

texts.en:
Karapet S. lives with his mother, wife and two children in Talin. Together with his wife, Karapet looks after their cattle farm and fruit orchards. In addition to this, Karapet is a seasonal construction worker, which gives his family additional income. 

Karapet has been a good borrower with SEF for years, and thanks to previous loans he has been able to increase his number of cattle. Currently the cattle barn roof requires renovation, and for this purpose Karapet has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To renovate the roof of the cattle barn

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha es cliente nueva  es su primer crédito con nuestra institución,  ella es propietaria de un vehículo minibús,  esta  afiliado en el sindicato, la Sra. Martha trabaja como ayudante en  su minibús para reducir  gastos  con su esposo  Max quien es el conductor, la Sra. Martha se encarga de cobrar y de vocear,  viven en la zona Urkupiña Ambos realizan el  trabajo constante  para cumplir con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia con expectativa de mejores logros, son muy trabajadores, la Sr. Martha esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Martha is a new client and this is her first loan with our institution.  She is the owner of a minibus, and is affiliated with a union.  Martha works as a money collector in the bus with her husband to reduce costs.  Max is the driver, and Martha takes the money and yells out for people's stops.  They live in the area known as Urkupiña.  They both work constantly to meet their goal of improving their family's quality of life.  They work very hard because they expect to achieve a lot.  Martha is grateful to the institution for the help they have given her.

loans.use: Engine maintenance and ring change

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy trees, fertilizer, stands, fencing, fuel

loans.name: Fabiola Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Fabiola  es comerciante de ropa, ella vende poleras, tiene un hijo de 8 mese de edad, vive en la casa de su mamá quien le ayuda con el cuidado de su bebe, tiene cuatro hermanos  a quienes ayuda a mantener, su papá es albañil, ella es muy joven y emprendedora su negocio lo realiza viajando al desaguadero de donde trae la mercadería y la lleva a vender a Cochabamba ahora quiere llevar y traer mercadería también de Oruro para ello solicito el crédito para la compra de poleras por docena, su meta es hacer crecer su negocio  y enseñar a sus hermanas menores  esta labor  y hacer construir su casa en el terreno que tienen donde actualmente viven en dos cuartitos, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Fabiola is a clothes saleswoman - she sells shirts.  She has an 8 month old son, and lives with her mother who helps her to care for the baby.  She has four siblings, who she helps to take care of.  Her father is a mason.  She is very young and entrepreneurial.  She travels to Desaguadero to get her merchandise and takes them to Cochabamba to be sold.  She would also like to begin carrying and bringing merchandise from Oruro, and for this she has asked for a loan to buy shirts by the dozen.  Her goal is to grow her business and teach her younger sisters the work, and to build a house on the land where they currently live in two small rooms.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: To buy shirts by the dozen

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary was born in 1964. She is a widow and blessed with four kids, none below 15 years of age. She is a hard working lady and has faced many challenges in life, such as being a widow at a young age, ill health and being unable to take care of her children. Due to all of these challenges, she made up her mind to become a GHAPE member in the year 2009.

In this same year, Mary received her pioneer loan of 40,000 XAF, and the repayment was done promptly. With her new loan of 75,0000 XAF, she plans to buy seedlings. She is sure the business will succeed because she has been doing this business for a long period of time. She has good land for farming.

Her neighbors are happy for the business she is doing because it will reduce their distances to the market and because they will be able to buy from her at a cheaper cost. She plans to use the profit from the business to plow back into the business, care for her son and provide good medical attention for herself and her son. She prefers borrowing from GHAPE because of the social services GHAPE offers, and because the method of repayment is comfortable. 

About GHAPE:  
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús,  de 65 años de edad , es originario de  el Ocotolillo,Yali municipio del  departamento  de Jinotega , es padre de familia de 7 hijos , de oficio agricultor , se dedica a la siembra de café y granos básicos, debido a  su pobreza no pudo aprender a leer ni escribir durante su niñez, ya que tuvo que trabajar desde muy temprana edad , pero sin embargo hoy en día ha asistido a centro de enseñanzas para adulto mayores donde les enseñan a leer y a escribir . Inicio en el área de la siembra gracias a un tío que le enseño este oficio, pues tuvo una infancia difícil, su padre lo abandono cuando era un niño dejando a su madre sola con la crianza de el y sus hermanos. A la edad de 8años ayudaba a su tío en las labores de arpillado de maíz, arriar ganado. Trabajo con su tío unos 25 años para ese entonces le había dado unos 3metros de terreno en arriendo para que sembrara frijol y maíz. A los doce año ahorro su  dinero y pudo comprar su propio terreno de 16 metros, el mismo lo vendió para poder  adquirir otro terreno ubicado en el Ocotolillo. Se caso a la edad  de  30 años cuando tenía su finca propia donde ha criado a sus hijos dándole estudio hasta donde ha podido. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder dar mantenimiento a su finca de café y actividades de la misma como llenado de bolsas, regulación de siembra y abono. Dentro  de  sus planes futuros esta mejorar las condiciones de la finca, renovación del café viejo, para poder levantar el rendimiento de la cosecha y mejorar la calidad del café. Su principal meta es  la ampliación de terreno de su finca de 8 metros a 10 metros, pues  de  esta  manera podrá sembrar más y mejorar  sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jesús, 65 years old, is originally from Ocotolillo, in the municipaltiy of Yali in the department of Jinotega.  He is the father of 7 children, and works as a farmer.  He plants coffee and basic grains.  Due to his poverty, he didn't learn to read or write during his childhood, as he had to work from a very young age.  Nevertheless, today he attends the adult learning center for older adults where they teach them to read and write.   

He began planting thanks to an uncle who taught him the trade, since he had a difficult infancy and was abandoned by his father when he was young, leaving his mother alone to raise him and his brothers.  At the age of 8 he helped his uncle with piling up the corn and herding cattle. He worked with his uncle for 25 years, and for this he had given him 3 meters of land to plant beans and corn. At the age of 12, he saved his money and was able to buy 16 meters of land himself.  He sold it to buy a different plot of land located in Ocotolillo. He married at the age of 30 when he already had his own farm, where he raised his children and sent them to school as long as he was able. 

He asks for a loan to be able to maintain his coffee farm, including activities like filling bags, regulating planting, and manure.  His future plans include improving the condition of the farm, renovating the old coffee in order to get a better yield from the harvest, and improving the quality of the coffee.  His main goal is to increase the amount of land his has from 8 to 10 meters, since this way he will be able to plant more and increase his income, and at the same time improve his family's quality of life and give them financial stability.

loans.use: Maintain the coffee farm, regulate planting and buy manure

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 20 años, vive en concubinato con Elvis, con quien tiene una hijita, Yeimy. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Hace 2 años comenzó a producir la tierra; en 2 de sus 5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, plantó café, los cuales están creciendo sin mayores dificultades, y dentro de un año darán sus primeros granos. Pero consiente que durante todo este tiempo  tiene que generar ingresos, plantó plátanos los cuales le proporcionan frutos cada 15 días. También trabaja en la hacienda de la señora Marian, haciendo matapaleo (proceso del podado de plantas para su mejor crecimiento). Ahora ella desea adquirir un buen capital de trabajo para poder plantar café en la totalidad de su terreno agrícola. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es secretaría de su asociación, comprometida a cumplir los acuerdos que se tomen en cada reunión. Elizabeth, después de la cosecha de café, está pensando con el crédito comprar varias plantitas de café para preparar los almácigos (pequeño viveros donde crece las plantas) para la próxima temporada, asimismo herramientas para limpiar y podar sus plantas.
texts.en: 20 year old Elizabeth lives with her partner, Elvis, with whom she has a little girl, Yeimy. They live together in their own home, located in the indigenous community of Kivinake (in the central jungle of Peru). Two years ago, she began working the land. She planted coffee on 2 of her 5 hectares of agricultural land, and this is growing without significant problems and will give its first crop within a year. But, because she is aware that she needs to generate income during all this time, she planted bananas that provide fruit every 15 days. She also works on the farm run by Mrs Marian, doing pruning to improve the growth of the plants. Now she wants to secure business capital to plant coffee on all her agricultural land. She belongs to the community bank "flor de almendra", where she is secretary of the association, and this is the first loan that she has had from MFP. She promises to meet the repayment agreements at each meeting. After the coffee harvest, Elizabeth is thinking of using the loan to buy more coffee seedlings to prepare seedbeds (small nurseries where the plants grow) for the next season, and also tools to clean and prune her plants.

loans.use: To buy coffee plant seedlings and tools for pruning her plants

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La Señora Alba Luz tiene la 39 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Alba tiene 4 hijos menores de edad, sus propósitos son seguir manteniendo la atención de sus clientes y así mismo mejorar el nivel de calidad del pan que ella elabora. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de rosquillas, cosa de horno entre otros, el negocio está ubicado en el reparto la resistencia. Inicio porque ella necesitaba proporcionar ingresos  a su familia, es entonces que decide establecer este medio de vida en su vivienda, aunque al principio no fue fácil realizar este tipo de trabajo, sin embargo Doña Alba aprovecho la oportunidad. Este financiamiento para la compra de harina, huevo, mantequilla moldes entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Alba Luz is 39 years old, and she has a partner and four young children. Her goal is to continue providing service to her customers and to improve the quality of the bread that she bakes. She works making and selling donuts and other baked goods. The business is located in an area she annexed from her home. She began because she needed to provide income for her family, then she decided to establish this way of earning a living in her home. Although it wasn't easy to do this sort of work in the beginning, Alba nonetheless took advantage of the opportunity. This loan will be used to buy flour, eggs, butter molds, and more.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maritza; La socia es casada,  tiene 45 años de edad, y tiene 1 hijo, la socia, se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción, ella también tiene una pequeña ferretería, la socia trabaja de forma independiente y ya tiene sus proveedores, ellos le traen la mercadería y ella paga a fin de mes, La socia desea dar un adelanto para descargar unos materiales en su negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para dar un adelanto para que descarguen la mercadería en su negocio.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Juntas y Unidas". This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, Cusco Province, in the Department of Cusco.
The member is Maritza. She is married, 45 years old, and has 1 son. She sells construction materials and also has a small hardware store. She works for herself and already has suppliers. They currently bring her the supplies that she needs and she pays them at the end of the month. The member wants to pay in advance to secure some materials for her store. The member needs the loan to pay in advance so that the suppliers will deliver the merchandise.
The member is happy with the loan offered and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to pay in advance for some supplies to be delivered to her business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia, de 26 años, es una mujer sería y trabajadora. Junto a su esposo Juan cuidan de sus 5 hijos en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de kivinaki (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 19 años, es la agricultura. En sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas siembra toda variedad de cítricos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder quitar la maleza que crece entre los árboles de fruto, ya que le agrada verlos limpios y sanos. “El éxito para la obtención de un buen fruto, depende mucho del buen cuidado”, afirma. Pues los frutos de Celia, son muy bien cotizados, tanto así que los mismos comerciantes de frutas llegan a su propio terreno agrícola a comercializar sus productos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde espera trabajar con mucho ahínco para sacar adelante a su asociación. Celia, comenta que las constantes lluvias que existen en esta temporada, causaron que su cosecha de tangelo  (fruta cítrica) sufriera un retraso en el proceso de maduración. Por ello el próximo mes extraerá la fruta de los árboles que piensa fertilizar con el crédito que solicita.
texts.en: Celia is 26 years old. She is a serious and hardworking woman. Together with her husband, Juan, they take care of their 5 children in their own home located in the native community of Kivinaki (central Peruvian jungle). The work she has done for the last 19 years is farming. In her 2 hectares of farming land she plants every type of citrus. What she likes the most about her job is being able to take out the weeds that grow around the fruit trees, since she enjoys seeing them clean and healthy. “Success in getting a good product depends a lot on good care", she affirms.  Celia's products are much in demand. So much so that the fruit merchants themselves go to her farmland to obtain them. She belongs to the 'Flor de Almendra' [Almond Flower] community bank, and this is the first loan that she has had with MFP. She plans on working very hard to get her association ahead. Celia comments that the constant rain that has fallen this season has caused her crop of tangelos (a citrus fruit) to suffer a setback in the maturation process. Because of this, next month the she will extract the fruit from the trees that she is planning to fertilize with the loan she is asking for.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to apply to her citrus plants.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: La Sra.  MARTHA es nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de el 08 de marzo de 1968 estado civil soltera tiene una hija, su nombre es Elena, estudia en un colegio fiscal de su barrio tiene 16 años cursa el segundo medio el sueño de la señora Martha  es que su hija sea una bachiller y luego que ingrese a la universidad estatal y tenga una carrera profesional , su objetivo de la señora es llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes  en su domicilio en la actualidad su tienda de abarrote esta en la casa de su señora madre  La señora lleva trabajando en la venta de abarrotes  5 años . Solicito el crédito a emprender  por que necesita surtir su tienda comprando mercadería en general, es una persona muy trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Martha was born in the city of Santa Cruz on the 8th of March of 1968. She is single and has a daughter. Her name is Elena and she goes to a public high school in the neighborhood. She is 16 and in her second year. Martha's dream is for her daughter to be a high school graduate and then to go on to the public university and have a professional career. Her objective is to have a grocery store in her house. At present, her grocery store in in her mother's house. She has been selling groceries for 5 years. She is asking for the loan because she needs to supply her store by buying general merchandise. She is a very hardworking person who really wants to get ahead and she is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: To buy general groceries

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en: Garnik lives with his wife and grandfather.  After completing his duty in the Army, he started working in well-known Armenian writer Sero Khanzadyan’s museum as a security officer.  As his job is part-time, he is using his extra time to organize a semi-wholesale trade, which is helping him to improve his family’s standard of living. Garnik has many relationships with businesses in other countries and is focused mainly on importing stuffed animals.  His company’s products are well-designed and high in quality.  He is purchasing the toys in bulk, and distributing them to retail traders and shops. He applied for a loan through SEF to increase his inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more stuffed animals

loans.name: Eudez

texts.es: Eudez, de 47 años, esta casada con Eduardo, con quien tiene 8 hijos, a los que cría en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura, ya tiene 20 años sembrando café, naranja y achiote. Lo que más le gusta de su labor son las épocas de cosecha, pues recoge con satisfacción los frutos que cuidó con mucho esmero. Asimismo su esposo trabaja en jornadas de trabajo en otros terrenos agrícolas obteniendo un dinero extra para su hogar. Ahora ellos se están preparando para la “rebusca” de la primera cosecha de café. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está segura podrá obtener al aliado incondicional para el progreso de sus cultivos. Eudez, dentro de pocos días comenzará a cosechar los granos de café, por ello con el crédito está pensando contratar personal para que le ayuden en la recolección y en el limpiado de sus plantaciones de “achiote”.
texts.en: Eudez is 47 years old. She is married to Eduardo, with whom she has 8 children. She is raising them in the family home, located in the native community of Kivinaki (central Peruvian jungle). The work she does is farming, and she has been planting coffee, oranges and annato for 20 years. What she likes the most about her work is the harvest times, since she reaps the products she cared for so much with satisfaction. In addition, her husband works on other farmland, obtaining extra income for their home.  Now they are getting ready for the first coffee harvest. She belongs to the “Flor de Almendra” [Almond Flower] community bank and this is the first loan that she has had with MFP, where she is certain she can have an unconditional ally for her crops' progress. In a few days, Eudez will start to harvest her coffee beans. Because of this, she is planning on hiring workers to help her in the picking and in clearing the annato plantings.

loans.use: To hire workers to to pick coffee and clear the annato plantings.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: La Sr, Juan es nacido en la ciudad de Tarija el 10  de febrero de  1969 tiene como responsabilidad llevar adelante su hogar, su conyugue es la señora  Nancy tienen un hijo de 10  año, el señor Juan Carlos  lleva trabajando en este rubro de lo que es el alquiler de camioneta hace 6 años. Solicito el crédito en emprender lo cual se la esta brindando una el apoyo necesario para que el pueda salir adelante el crédito tiene como destino el mantenimiento de su camioneta reparación del motor, es una persona responsable y trabajadora tiene ganas de superación y desea mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, el Sr, Juan esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan was born in the city of Tarija on February 10th, 1969.  His responsibility is to get his household ahead.  He and his wife, Nancy, have a ten year old son.

Juan Carlos has worked in the field of renting a truck for six years. 

He requested a loan from Emprender, which is providing him with the needed support to get ahead.  He will use the loan for maintenance on his truck and to repair the motor.  He is a responsible and hard-working person with a great desire to succeed.  He wishes to improve the quality of life for his whole family.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided to him.

loans.use: Maintenance on his truck (general mechanics)

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira lives with 6 members of her family: her husband (an engineer), her sister, her retired parents, and her two school-aged children.  Naira started her business since 2004.  She rents a stall and trades in fruits and vegetables.  Business is going well and there is demand for more of her produce. She has applied for a loan from SEF to acquire more inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more produce

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: Ruben P. lives with his wife and 2 children in Goris. He runs his own agricultural business in the village of Khndzoresk. His two girls need to enroll at a university, and it is vital for Ruben to ensure that he has sufficient funds for this. He has applied for this loan to increase the number of his cattle, expand his business, and increase his income to meet his children’s education needs.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La  Señorita Patricia, nacida el la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la sierra el 21 de noviembre de 1988 estado civil soltera, su objetivo de la  señora  es llegar  a  abrir una  sucursal de ventas de salteñas  en el centro de la ciudad , para hacer crecer su negocio, lleva trabajando en la venta de salteñas  1 años, aprendio este oficio debido a que su madre  tiene la misma actividad y el le enseño el oficio , solicito su crédito a emprender el cual se le esta dando el apoyo necesario su crédito será destinado para la compra de un horno y también para la ampliación de su negocio, es una joven emprendedora y muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de superación y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Patricia was born in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra on November 21st, 1988.  She is single.  Her objective is to open a branch of “salteña” (Bolivian empanada) sales in the center of the city.  She wants to do this to make her business grow.  She has been working selling salteñas for one year.  She learned this business activity because her mother does the same thing.  Her mother taught her the business.

She requested a loan from Emprender, which is giving her the necessary support.  She is an enterprising and very hard-working young woman who has a great desire to succeed.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To buy an oven to make salteñas

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 25 years old, married, and has a 4 year old child. She owns a shop in which she sells several household items such as sugar, rice, salt, and more. She is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her business.  She will use the extra profits to help meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her shop

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: La Sra. Felicia, se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene 39 años. Vive en el Barrio  7 de Julio, El Esposo se dedica a la reparación de vehículos, tiene tres hijos  los cuales van al colegio, hay uno de ellos que trabaja con el padre, Su Hija le Ayuda a preparar  la comida y atender a la clientela Son personas responsables las cuales tienen grandes deseos de superación. La señora Felicia se levanta desde muy temprano a preparar el menú del día, Trabajan desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche y a veces hasta muy tarde de la noche todo por el bienestar de sus hijos, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Comprara mesas y sillas para su negocio y así poder brindar mejor atención a sus clientes, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Felicia, age 39, sells food.  She lives in the 7 de Julio neighborhood.  Her husband repairs vehicles.

She has three children, and they go to school.  One of them works with his father.  Her daughter helps her prepare the food and wait on the customers.  

They are responsible people who have a great desire to succeed.  Felicia gets up very early to prepare the day’s menu.  They work from seven in the morning until seven at night.  Sometimes they work until very late in the evening.  They do this for their children’s well-being.

She will use the money from the loan to buy tables and chairs for her business.  That way she will be able to provide her customers with better service.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, es una mujer de 31 años; que está casada con Wilder; con quien tiene 4 menores hijos a los que cuida mucho en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). Hace 15 años que se dedica a la siembra de cítricos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son los días de esfuerzo y sacrificio que en cada cosecha tienen su recompensa, puesto que sus buenos cuidados le resultan muy favorables en cada cosecha que comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad. Como ella es una mujer trabajadora; también ayuda a limpiar la maleza de otros terrenos agrícolas, donde recibe un buen dinero por su esfuerzo. Ahora desea trabajar con mucho ahínco para poder expandir sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una mujer respetuosa y muy trabajadora. Doris, hace poco heredó de parte de su padre una parcela de terreno agrícola, donde piensa sembrar café, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varias plantitas de café como también sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con la siembra.
texts.en:
Doris is a 31 year old woman, married to Wilder with whom she has 4 young children that they care for in their own home.  They live in the indigenous community of Kivinaki in the central Peruvian forest.  For 15 years she has cultivated citrus crops.  What she likes most about her work are the days of labor and sacrifice, which pay off with each harvest since her good care of the crops results in favorable returns when they take the crops to the central market of the city.   Since she is a hardworking woman, she also helps to clean the underbrush on other farmlands, and is paid well for this work.  

Now she would like to work diligently to expand her 2 hectares of farm land.  She belongs to the village bank "Flor de Almendra" and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is known as a very respectful and hardworking woman.  Not long ago, Doris inherited a parcel of farmland from her father, where she would like to plant coffee.  With this loan she is thinking about buying some small coffee plants and also sacks of organic compost to begin planting.

loans.use: Buy coffee plants and sacks of manure

loans.name: Santa Rosita De Huaytara Group

texts.en:
The rural community bank “Santa Rosita Huaytara” is in its 3rd loan cycle. The group is located in the Huaytara community of Huancavelica province in Peru. Some of their members have stores where they sell a range of products, some sell dairy products, and others are dedicated to livestock. 

Solange is a member of the bank and has 2 children with her live-in partner. Her children are both studying. She works as a secretary for the local government and also sells cosmetic products. She will be using her loan of 1,000 PEN to buy cosmetic products and find outlets to sell them.
