Tomé es una comuna del sur de Chile, ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Su economía local se sustentaba de manera importante en la actividad textil que se origina a fines del siglo XIX, con fábricas que producen paños de lana de oveja, Textiles Bellavista Oveja Tomé, cerrada en 2007, trayendo consigo altas tasas de desempleo que han sido cubiertas por nuevas actividades económica.
texts.en:
Noelia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mirar al Futuro Dichato” (Look to the Future – Dichato), which consists of 18 entrepreneurs who work in activities such as making crafts, baking, and cooking. They live in the city of Tomé.

Noelia, who appears in the top corner photo, works as a baker. Specifically she makes cakes, cream puffs, and whole grain bread. She started this business in her home five years ago. Her regular customers are her neighbors who come to her house to place orders. However, she also sells baked goods door-to-door so that she can generate publicity for her business. Noelia buys all of her baking ingredients from the wholesale supermarket since the prices are cheaper. She works alone in her business, but she also gets help from her daughters (ages 18 and 10) who clean the used cooking utensils. With this loan, Noelia will buy supplies and ingredients for her business, specifically a cylinder of natural gas, flour, flaxseed, sugar, pastry cream, butter, and other products.

Noelia dreams of having a shop in her home where she can display the goods that she prepares so that she can be recognized for her baking. In this manner, she hopes to generate income to help her obtain a better quality of life. Her motivation to continue her business stems from her love of desserts. She also likes having income to cover the household expenses and the university studies of her oldest daughter. Noelia is extremely grateful to Fondo Esperanza. She enjoys attending the meetings because of the communication, friendship, loyalty, and trust that she has developed with the other entrepreneurs in her group. This explains why the other members selected her to be the president of the Communal Bank. The funding she has received from Fondo Esperanza has been a great help to her business since she is able to invest more and increase her earnings.

Tomé is a community in southern Chile, located near the city of Concepción in Bíobío region. The local economy is sustained primarily by the textile industry, which has its origins in the late nineteenth century. These factories produced wool cloth. The Bellavista Oveja Factory in Tomé shut down in 2007, creating high unemployment which has since been eased by new business activities.

loans.use: To purchase baking supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Hugo Alejandro

texts.es:
Hugo , de 44 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad la pita de la comarca Miraflor municipio de Estelí , es casado ,tiene 6 hijos , de oficio agricultor , en el cual lleva 25 años trabajando con el cultivo de hortalizas. Debido a su procedencia humilde la oportunidad de estudiar eran escasas pues no tenía recursos para poder seguir estudiando así que solo llego hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Inicio a sembrar con  esfuerzos propios  trabajando bajo un sol incesante todos los días desde los doce años. Al cumplir 16 años sembró media manzana  de papa de la cual obtuvo una ganancia que la invirtió en comprar una vaca. Luego siguió con la siembra de  hortalizas con la cual pudo comprar su propio terreno fruto de la venta de su siembra. Se caso a los 17 años , de todos sus hijos 2 de ellos están en primer año de la universidad, otros están en tercer año de la secundaria donde ellos caminan 1 hora para poder llegar a la escuela y  otro que le ayuda a sembrar pero con la primaria aprobada. El siembra repollo, cebolla, papa, tomate.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abono y pago de mano de obra para saca adelante su cultivo, para garantizar rendimiento y calidad. Con esta cosecha el espera lograr ampliar su área de terreno y poder pagar los gastos que genere el producir esta cosecha.
Tiene como  meta que sus hijos logren tener una carrera universitaria, lograr auto sostenibilidad y desarrollar nuevos proyectos de siembra de papa, repollo.
texts.en:
Hugo, age 44, is originally from the community of La Pita in the town of Estelí in Miraflor region. He is married and has six children. Hugo has been growing vegetables for 25 years. He comes from humble origins, so he had few opportunities to continue studying due to a lack of resources. Hugo was only able to achieve a third grade education. He started growing his own crops under the relentless heat of the sun and has been doing this every day for twelve years. When he turned 16, Hugo planted potatoes and used his earnings to invest in the purchase of a cow. He continued to grow vegetables until he was able to buy his own land.

Hugo got married when he was 17. Of all his children, two are in their first year of college. There are others who are in their third year of high school and must walk one hour to get to their classes. Another child helps with planting and has passed elementary school.

Hugo grows cabbages, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, compost, and pay for labor to continue with the cultivation of his crops to promote output and quality. With this harvest, he hopes to expand the size of his farm so that he can pay his expenses with the revenue he generates. His goals include seeing his children earn their university degrees, achieving self-sustainability, and developing new crops of potatoes and cabbages.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies, fertilizers, and compost

loans.name: Claudia Nelly

texts.es: La señora Claudia tiene 30 años. Es madre de 2 hijos ha luchado para salir adelante. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que labora con esta actividad, por lo que es importante para ella. Ya que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas, hace buenas relaciones y eso la ayuda a incrementar su lista de clientes, de esa manera sigue incrementando sus ventas. El financiamiento que solicita es parar capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, refrescos, gaseosas, detergentes entre otras cosas. En un futuro le gustaría tener su propia distribuidora para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudia is 30 years old. As a mother of two children, she struggles to get ahead. Claudia has been managing a store for more than four years, so this business is important to her. She enjoys her work because she knows many people. By establishing good relationships, she has been able to expand her customer base so that she can continue increasing her sales.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy candy, soft drinks, detergents, and other products. In the future, she wants to open her own distribution center so that she can provide for her customers.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento NUEVO AMANECER esta conformado por 10 integrantes D. los cuales 7 son mujeres y 2 varones, La Sra. Esperanza  tiene dos hijos  el padre D. sus hijos le pasa  una pequeña pensión que apenas le alcanza para la alimentación, por este motivo la Sra. Tiene que salir a trabajar, ella,  se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y los fines D. semana se dedica a la venta D. comida   es muy trabajadora y su incentivo para seguir adelante son sus dos hijos, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería D. los productos que se encuentran en promoción y así tener variedad D. productos para poD. ofrecer a sus clientes, este banco D. emprendimiento este conformado por amigos  D. la zona  que  tienen una amistad D. hace varios años, cada una D. ellas tienen una actividad independiente trabajan todos los días conocidos con su respectiva actividad . es un banco muy organizado y  dinámico, todos los integrantes del banco están agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) consists of ten members, seven women and two men. Sra. Esperanza has two children. The father of her children earns a small pension that is barely enough to buy food. For this reason, Sra. Esperanza decided to go to work. She sells cosmetics and then serves food on the weekends. Esperanza is a hard worker and her two children are her incentive to move forward. The money from this loan will be used to buy merchandise that is on sale so that she can offer a variety of products to her customers.

This Communal Bank was formed by a group of local friends who have known each other for several years. Each one has an independent business. They are known each day for their respective activities. This Communal Bank is organized and dynamic. All of its members are grateful to Emprender for its support.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics in quantity

loans.name: Nelly Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Nelly; La socia es casada,  tiene 45 años de edad, y tiene 5 hijos,  el menor vive aún y depende de la socia; La socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia compra ladrillos, bloquetas, cemento y otros para la venta, ella desea aumentar su mercadería, la socia comenta que este negocio lo tiene en el barrio de San Sebastián y le ha permitido poder educar a sus hijos y dar comodidades al hogar, ahora la socia desea invertir el préstamo en el pago inicial de un nuevo pedido de materiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para dar la inicial de la mercadería.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly is a member of the Communal Bank “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United) which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 45 years old, married, and has five children. The youngest child lives with her and is still a dependent. Nelly buys and sells construction materials such as bricks, blocks, cement, and other items. She wants to increase her inventory of merchandise. Nelly says that her business is in the neighborhood of San Sebastián and has enabled her to provide her children with an education and a comfortable home. Now she wants to invest in a down payment for a new shipment of materials. The loan she is requesting will be used as her initial payment for ordering additional merchandise.

Nelly is happy with the loan that was provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Place a down payment on a new shipment of merchandise

loans.name: Jilma Del Socorro

texts.es: Jilma Del Socorro tiene 30 años, se dedica  a la venta y compra de cerdos. Hace más de 7 años tiene 2 hijos a su cargo.  Para poder sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su nivel de vida. Poco a poco fue ahorrando para comprar cerdos, ya que en su comarca este negocio es muy rentable, además que ella deposita mucho empeño en su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos, pues tiene que pagar para que una persona traslade los cerdos a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jilma Del Socorro is 30 years old and has two dependent children. She has been buying and selling pigs for more than seven years so that her family can get ahead and improve their standard of living. Jilma has been gradually saving in order to buy pigs since this type of business is very profitable in her region. She also says that she invests a great amount of effort into her business.

This loan will be used as operating capital to buy pigs. She will also pay someone to transport the pigs to her home.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire pigs & pay for transportation costs

loans.name: Arcoiris Palmira Group

texts.es: Este foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Sofia H., un integrante del grupo "Arcoiris Palmira" que esta ubicado en el estado de veracruz, se puede observar al grupo alrededor de la mercancia, la señora Sofía se dedica al alquiler de peliculas que inicio hace 10 años, solicita el prestamo para renovar su mercancia, al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente contenta ya que podrá invertir más en su negocio, tiene 59 años, estudio la primaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijos; quiere este crédito para renovar su mercancia, tembién espera hacer crecer más su negocio. Esther es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 54 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y es viuda, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercancia y así poder incrementar sus ventas, con el fin de tener una estabilidad economica ya que ella sola mantiene a sus hijos y para ella es indispensable ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This picture was taken in Señora Sofia H.'s business who is a member of the "Arcoiris Palmira" group, located in the state of Veracruz. The group is seated around the merchandise. Señora Sofia works renting movies, a business she started 10 years ago, and is asking for the loan to renovate her merchandise. Since asking for the loan she feels happy that she can invest more in her business. She is 59 years old, has a middle school education, and is married with two children. She is asking for the loan to renovate her merchandise, and also hopes to grow her business. 

Esther is the president of the group, is 54 years old, studied until middle school, and is a widow. Three years ago she began her business selling clothes. She is asking for the loan to purchase merchandise and to improve her sales with the goal of having economic stability, since she supports her children alone. She thinks it is essential to offer them a better quality of life and a professional career.

loans.use: To improve the business and increase profits

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, tiene 32 años de edad es originario de Yali, municipio de Estelí, es soltero, tiene 2 hijos, de oficio comerciante. Inicio sus actividades a la edad de 5años con su papa ayudando  en el cultivo de café y hortaliza. A los 12 años  se dedico al trabajo jornal, donde trabajaba para su propia manutención. A los 22 años conoció a la madre de sus hijos no se caso con ella solo se juntaron, al año y medio decidió sembrar  hortalizas, donde obtuvo buena ganancia y la invirtió en un negocio de pulpería, donde vendía granos básicos , cosas de uso personal , también se dedico al destace de cerdo con lo que pudo ahorrar  comprar su propia casa , su mayor logro ha sido poder mantener sus ventas y tener vehículo propio, de sus  hijos uno esta estudiando en la primaria y el otro tiene un año de edad. 
Solicita el crédito para invertir en el cultivo de café, darle mantenimiento, compra de herramientas como chapia para limpiar el cultivo. Espera que al darle buen mantenimiento al cultivo de café tendrá mayor producción con calidad. 
Sus planes futuros son ampliar las aéreas de café, surtir de mayor producto su pulpería y poder su producción de café directamente a las empresas distribuidora de café dentro y fuera de Estelí que le ofrezcan un buen precio mejor que los comerciantes.  Como meta principal asegurarles estudios profesionales a sus dos hijos ya que el por su pobreza, falta de apoyo no pudo continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Jose, 32, is a native of Yali in Nicaragua's Esteli region.  He is single with 2 children.  He started working when he was 5 years old, doing farm work for his father, tending the family garden and his father's coffee crop.  When he was 12 years old, he started full-time work because he had to support himself.  He met the mother of his children when he was 22 years old, but they've never married, only been together for years.  A year and a half later, he decided to plant vegetables and other produce that he then could sell.  He made enough to set up a small store selling everyday commodities--food and other everyday items--and a meat-butchering business.  He was able to use the income from the business to buy his own house.  He's succeeded in maintaining his level of sales and even buying a vehicle of his own.  One of his children is in elementary school and the other is one-year old.  
Jose is applying for a loan so that he can prepare his fields and plant coffee.  He hopes that preparing the fields in advance will allow him to increase the size and quality of his crop.
Jose's plans for the future are to increase his coffee production and stock his grocery business.  He also wants to sell his coffee crop directly to the companies that distribute coffee both in and away from Estel so that he can get a better price that he can get from local buyers.  His main goal is to make sure that his two children can finish their studies, something especially important to him because he had to drop out of school at a young age in order to support himself.

loans.use: Prepare fields and plant coffee for farming business.

loans.name: Alegria Del Cristo Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa de la señora Aleida U. tesorera del grupo "Alegria del Cristo" que esta ubicado en Orizaba estado de VeraC., se ve al grupo alrededor de la foto, ella se dedica a la venta de articulos para el hogar que inicio hace 7 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra de nueva mercancia, tiene 36 años, estudio la primaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, quiere este crédito para la compra de nueva mercancia, también espera poder mejorar su economia y mejorar su calidad de vida, para poder brindarles a sus hijos una C. profesional.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in the home of Aleida U., the treasurer of the 'Alegria del Cristo' (Joy of Christ) group which is located in Orizaba, in the State of VeraC..  The group's members can be seen around the table.

Aleida's business is selling household items and she started it 7 years ago.  Aleida is 36 years old, has an elementary school level of education, is married and has two children.  She is requesting this loan to buy new merchandise.  She also hopes to be able to improve her financial situation and her quality of life, so that she can provide her children with an education all the way up to university level.

loans.use: to invest in her business (to buy merchandise)

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria; La socia es casada,  tiene 29 años de edad, y tiene 3 hijos de (13,4,10 meses) ; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia compra todo tipo de materiales, desde, ladrillos, fierros, bloquetas, cemento y otros para la venta, ella desea aumentar su capital y con ello su mercadería, la socia tiene su negocio en el barrio de San Sebastián ella desea invertir el préstamo en capital de trabajo, la socia aumentara a un dinero que tiene guardado. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de este un pequeño capital de trabajo.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria, 29, is a member of the Juntas Y Unidas ("Together And United") community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Maria is married and has 3 children (13, 4, 10 months). She operates a business buying and selling construction materials.  The business is located in the San Sebastian neighborhood.  Sra. Maria buys all kinds of construction materials--bricks, rebar, cement blocks, concrete--for sale.  She wants to increase her inventory and expand her business.  She will supplement the loan with money that she has saved so that she has a bit of working capital set aside for the business.

Sra. Maria is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Working capital for construction supplies business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Justina; La socia es casada,  tiene 46 años de edad, y tiene 3 hijos de (29,24,10)años de edad; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia compra todo tipo de materiales, desde, piedras, arena, ladrillos, fierros, bloquetas, cemento y otros para la venta, ella desea aumentar su capital y con ello su mercadería, la socia hace de este préstamo un capital de trabajo ella paga y le dan los proveedores los materiales y de aquí a un mes ella da otra parte y en dos meses termina de pagar a sus proveedores y finalmente ella puede ver el ingreso liquido de su mercadería hasta un nuevo préstamo. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de este un pequeño capital de trabajo.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Juntas y Unidas" community bank. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, a province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Justina. The member is married, is 46 years old and has three children who are 29, 24, and 10 years of age. The member is dedicated to the buying and selling of construction materials. The member buys all types of materials from rocks, sand, bricks, irons, blocks, cement and other things for selling. She desires to increase her capital and, with it, her merchandise. The member will use this loan as working capital to pay the suppliers of the materials and, in a month, she'll give another part and in two months she'll finish paying her suppliers and finally she can see the net income of her merchandise and obtain a new loan. The member is requesting the loan so she may have a small amount of working capital.

The member is happy with the loan granted and promises to repay at the established deadlines.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan for a small amount of working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase balanced feed and fix the area where he raises his livestock.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Marilu; La socia es casada,  tiene 39 años de edad, y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia compra todo tipo de materiales, desde, piedras, arena, ladrillos y agregados para la venta, ella desea aumentar su capital y con ello su mercadería, la socia hace de este préstamo un capital de trabajo ella comprará materiales al por mayor  y de este modo se abastecerá. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Juntas y Unidas" community bank. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Marilu. She is married and is 39 years old and has two children. She is dedicated to buying and selling construction materials. She buys all types of materials including rocks, sand, bricks and gravel to sell. She wishes to increase her capital and with it her  merchandise. The member is requesting this loan of working capital to buy materials at wholesale prices and, in this way, get supplies. The member is requesting the loan to purchase construction materials.

The member is happy with the loan granted and promises to make her payments at the established deadlines.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Las Del Río (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las del Rió está conformado por 13 mujeres quienes viven en  comunidades alrededor de la parroquia de Jadan, esta lugar  tiene una  belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su gente también labora en la ciudad. Nuestras socias con sus diferentes trabajos ayudan a que sus hogares salgan adelante, son mujeres alegres y trabajadoras.

La Señora. Clara Dolores J. vive por la parroquia de Jadan, se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su vecina a formar parte de este grupo. 
Tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de 19, 18, 13, 11, 9 años y  sus dos últimos hijos que  son gemelos tienen  un año y cuatro meses de edad, su primer hijo   trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segundo y tercer hijo estudian en el colegio, su cuarto hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción ya que es maestro albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña Clara Dolores tiene una tienda hace 10 años, labora en ella de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, también se dedica a la cría de animales como: borregos, cuyes, gallinas y chanchos que los vende en su comunidad. 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda y así crecer un poco más. Su meta es tener un galpón de pollos.

La Señora. María Eulalia J. vive en la comunidad del progreso de Jadan, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal.
Tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de  20, 18, 16, 14, 9 y 6 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar, su cuarta hija estudia en colegio y sus dos últimos hijos están en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como albañil y también de agricultor, no tiene casa propia y viven cuidando  una casa.
Doña María Eulalia se dedica al cuidado de una casa, actividad que la realiza hace 8 años en donde labora en la agricultura, también se dedica a la cría de animales como: cuyes, chanchos, ganado y gallinas a los que vende en su propia comunidad.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las del Rió is made up of 13 women who live in the surrounding communities of the Jadan parish. This place has a natural beauty and the people work raising animals and in agriculture. Many of the people also work in the city. Our members, each with their different jobs, are helping their households to get ahead. They are happy and hard-working women.

Mrs. Clara Dolores J. lives in the Jadan parish and this is her first loan in the communal bank after being invited by her neighbour to join the group. She is 37 years old, married, and has 7 children aged 19, 18, 13, 11, and 9, and her two youngest children are one year and four month old twins. Her oldest son works and helps the household economy. Her second and third sons are in high school, and her fourth son goes to a primary school in the city. Her husband works in construction and is a master builder. Through both of their work they have managed to build their own house. Clara Dolores has had a store for 10 years. She works there from Sunday to Sunday and from 7 in the morning to 9 at night. She also raises animals such as sheep, guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs that she sells in her community. She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of more products for her store to grow a little more. Her goal is to have a barn for her chickens.  

Mrs. María Eulalia J. lives in the community of Jadan and this is the second loan she has requested from the communal bank. She is 36 years old, married and has 6 children 20, 18, 16, 14, 9, and 6 years old. Her three oldest children work and help the household economy. Her fourth daughter goes to high school and her two youngest children go to a local primary school. Her husband works as a builder as well as a farmer. They do not have their own house and live by taking care of a house. Maria Eulalia works as a housekeeper. An activity she has done for 8 years, and where she works in agriculture. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, cattle, and chickens which she sells in her community. She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of guinea pigs. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, basic products and guinea pigs

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Guillermina; La socia es casada,  tiene 55 años D. edad, y tiene 4 hijos todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica a la elaboración D. tortas, ella hace este negocio a pedido,  la socia también realiza tejidos, ella hace bellas chompas a palitos y crochet, la socia requiere en esta oportunidad el crédito para poder comprar materiales, ella quiere comprar lanas para hacer dos que tiene pedidos para sus amigas y necesita comprar las madejas D. lanas y botones. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. lanas y botones para la venta.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas” Communal Bank located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.  

The member’s name is Guillermina.  She is 55 years old, married, and has 4 independent, adult children.  Her business is making cakes on order.  She also makes clothing.  She crochets and knits beautiful sweaters.  She is requesting the loan at this time to buy materials.  She wishes to buy wool to complete two orders for her friends and needs to buy skeins of wool and buttons.  She is requesting this loan to purchase wool and buttons for sale.  

Guillermina is happy to be receiving the loan and is committed to making the payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to purchase wool and buttons for sale.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es: Nataly, de 23 años, vive en casa de su madre en compañía de ella y de su pequeño hijo de tres años y sus hermanas menores; juntos buscan progresar cada día. Desde hace tres años, esta empeñosa joven trabaja para una empresa inmobiliaria y se dedica a la atención en un puesto de venta de terrenos ubicada en una zona joven del cono norte de la ciudad. Le va muy bien en esta labor pues es tranquila y puede repartir su tiempo para atender su pequeño puesto de venta de jugos que tiene en un mercado de la zona, y las dos actividades le proporcionan buenas rentas por lo que puede ayudar a su madre en los gastos del hogar. Dice que por el trabajo no puede pasar mucho tiempo con su pequeño, pero sabe que debe trabajar para sacarlo adelante, pues es madre soltera, y como es una mujer emprendedora tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en una pieza de la casa de su madre. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Nataly tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de gaseosas e ingredientes que necesita para surtir mejor su jugueria, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias y continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Nataly, age 23, lives in her mother’s house along with her mother, her small son, age 3, and her three younger sisters. Together, they try to make progress each day.

For three years this diligent young woman has worked for a real estate business in a sales office located in a new area in the northern part of the city. She does very well in this job since it is quiet, and she can devote part of her time attending to the small juice stand which she has in the neighborhood’s market. The two jobs give her good income so that she can help her mother with the household expenses. She says that because of her work she isn’t able to spend much time with her little one, but she knows that since her mother is single she should work in order to get ahead. Nataly is an enterprising woman who plans to open a food shop in a part of her mother’s house.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her installments on time because she doesn’t want to make a bad impression on the people who made this loan possible. It will permit her to continue working to make progress. Nataly plans to invest the loan in the purchase of soft drinks and ingredients that she needs to better supply her juice stand. In this way she hopes to improve her earnings and to continue to get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and ingedients for stocking her juice stand.

loans.name: Diudora

texts.en:
Diudora has been a member of the Communal Bank “Legion” for the past 11 years.

She is 38 years old, married, and has three children, including a 3-week-old baby. Diudora has a replacement auto-parts store on Arenales Avenue, and her husband owns a repair shop for cars.

Diudora will be using her loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of spare parts that will be brought from the city of Lima.

Diudora’s dreams are for her children to become professionals, to have a larger store, and to have her own car to transport her products.

loans.use: Purchase of spare auto parts

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en: Basilia is 57 years old, married, and has seven children who are all studying. She is a member of the bank "Senor D. Huanca" at FINCA Peru. She runs a bakery in her house, where she makes basic breads. She uses a handmaD. wood-fired oven. She sells at the fairs in the area -- she and her husband travel to them together. In addition, Basilia has a small grocery store. Basilia needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy flour and sugar. Basilia hopes that her children can complete their studies, and she would like to continue saving.

loans.use: Purchase of flour and sugar

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Sandra; La socia es conviviente,  tiene 25 años de edad, y tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad, la socia se dedica compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia compra todo tipo de materiales, desde, piedras, arena, ladrillos y agregados para la venta, ella desea aumentar su capital  y comprar bloker que es un tipo de ladrillos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción en especial bloker.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”. This bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Sandra. She lives with her partner and is 25 years old. She has a two-year old son. She works buying and selling construction supplies. She buys all kinds of materials from stones, sand, nails, and aggregates to sell. She wants to increase her capital and buy bloker, which is a type of nail. This member is requesting a loan to buy construction materials, specifically bloker. 

The member is happy for the loan granted and she promises to make her repayments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy construction materials

loans.name: Juan Victor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Juan; El socio es soltero,  y es conductor, el socio trabaja como chofer de buses, en la ruta de Cusco Urubamba, el socio es una persona muy trabajadora y su papá le presta el vehículo para que el trabaje, el socio está ahorrando y poco a poco comprando sus artefactos e implementando su casa, en esta oportunidad el socio desea invertir en la compra de un refrigerador, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un refrigerador. 

El socio está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas“ Communal Bank located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco, department of Cusco.  

The member’s name is Juan.  He is unmarried and works as a bus driver on the Cusco Urubamba route.  He is a very hard-working person and his father lends him the vehicle for work.  He is saving and gradually buying appliances and furnishing his home.  He is requesting the loan at this time to purchase a refrigerator.  

Juan is happy to be receiving the loan and is committed to making the payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to purchase a refigerator.

loans.name: Esperanzas Del Valle Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en casa D. la señora Imelda Peña, presidenta del grupo "Esperanza del Valle" que esta ubicado en el estado D. Veracruz, la señora Imelda se dedica a la venta D. articuL. D. bazar que inicio hace 4 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra D. nueva mercancia, al solicitarlo se siente muy contenta ya que tiene la esperanza D. poder hacer crecer su negocio, ella tiene 38 años, estudió la secundaria y 3 hijos, quiere este crédito para adquirir mercancia, también espera realizar mejoras a su local. Lady C. es la tesorera del grupo, tiene 22 años, estudió la secundaria y es casada, se dedica a la venta D. ropa que inicio hace 4 años, solicita el prestamo para la compra D. mercancia y poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y así ser reconocida por todo la comunidad, la señora espera lograr su objetivo para poder tener una estabilidad economica y brindarle a sus hijos una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the home of Imelda Peña, the president of the "Esperanza del Valle" (Hope of the Valley) group which is located in the state of Veracruz.

Imelda's business is selling bazaar items.  She started her business 4 years ago and is requesting this loan to buy new merchandise.  She feels very happy as she requests her loan because she is hopeful that she will be able to grow her business.  Imelda is 38 years old, received a high school education, and has three children.  She would like this loan to buy more merchandise and to make some improvements to her premises.

Lady C. is the group's treasurer.  She is 22 years old, received a high school education and is married.  She has owned a business selling clothes for 4 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise so that she can offer more variety to her customers and thereby become well known by the whole community.  She hopes to achieve her goal so that she can enjoy financial stability and proviD. her children with a university level of education.

loans.use: to invest in more clothing to sell for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Huanca” at FINCA Peru. She is 41 years old, married and has four children in school. Victoria travels to the cities of Pisco and Ica where she sells different grains. She acquires her products at the suppliers’ market in the city of Ayacucho. She travels weekly to sell the grains. 


Her loan of 2000 PEN will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley, and corn. A few months ago, she was able to construct her house. She would like to expand it and run a store from her home one day.

loans.use: Purchase grain from markets for sale

loans.name: Maria Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria Paulina; La socia tiene 56 años de edad, la socia es separada,  tiene a todos sus hijos independientes, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortas, también vende cosméticos, la socia antes solía trabajar en el supermercado Mega en la ciudad de Cusco, pero ahora con sus ingresos del banco pudo dedicarse a la elaboración de tortas y las vende de forma independiente, la socia también  se ha inscrito en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, la socia desea el crédito para poder hacer de este un capital de trabajo y poder invertir en sus negocios y comprar insumos y materiales para la elaboración de tortas y también pedir unas ofertas para guardar hasta que estas salgan de los catálogos y los pueda ofrecer para tener un margen de ganancia.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN” community bank. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cuzco. 

The member is named Maria Paulina. She is 56 years old and separated. All of her children are grown. She makes cakes and sells cosmetics. Previously she worked in the Mega supermarket in the city of Cuzco, but now with her income from the bank she has been able to make and sell cakes independently. She has also signed up to sell cosmetics via catalogue. She is asking for the loan to be able to have some working capital and be able to invest in her businesses and buy ingredients ad materials to make cakes. In addition, she wants to ask for some samples to have until they come out in the catalogues and she can offer offer them and have a profit margin.   

The member is happy wit the loan that has been given to her and is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: To invest in her businesses

loans.name: Mujeres En Expansión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres en Expansión esta formado por 11 mujeres y 2 hombres que son amigos y vecinos, laboran en diferentes actividades que les permite superarse económicamente y ayudar a sus familias. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la  tercera ciudad más importante del país, tiene una gran belleza natural la misma que encanta a propio y extraños al igual que su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable y cordial.

La Señora. Sania Isabel P. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 30 años de edad, está separada de su esposo hace 2 años, tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9, 7 años, todos   estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Sania Isabel hace 4 mese se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Omnilife, trabaja sin un horario y de lunes a viernes. Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga que también se dedica a la venta de este producto. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos Omnilife. Su meta es  crecer en su negocio.

La Señora. Tania Lorena Z. vive por el sector del arenal alto en la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 2 años. Tiene 28 años, es divorciada  y tiene un hijo  de 13 años de edad que estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Vive con su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, su mamá tiene casa propia. 
Doña Tania Lorena es comerciante, se dedica a la atención de su bazar, está en esta actividad hace 4 años y labora de domingo a domingo. Ella aprendió costura a los 12 años de edad y ahora tambien trabaja en un taller  medio día de lunes a sábados. Divide su tiempo en sus dos trabajos. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más artículos para su bazar. Su meta es tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
The Mujeres en Expansión [Women in Expansion] community group is made up of 11 women and 2 men who are friends and neighbors. They work in different activities that allow them to get ahead financially and help their families. They live in the city of Cuenca, which is the third most important city in the country, It has a great natural beauty that is enchanting to its own people and to visitors alike. The people are kind and cordial.   

Mrs. Sania Isabel P. lives in downtown Cuenca. She is 30 years old and separated from her husband 2 years ago. She has 3 children, aged 11, 9 and 7. They go to a city school. Her husband works as a bricklayer. They do not own their own home and are renters.  

For 4 months, Sania Isabel has sold Omnilife brand natural products. She has no set schedule and works from Monday through Friday. This is the first loan that she has taken out the community bank and she was invited by a friend who also sells this product. She will invest the money from the loan in buying Omnilife products. Her goal is to grow her business. 

Mrs. Tania Lorena Z. lives in the Arenal Alto sector of the city of Cuenca. She has been in the community bank for  2 years. She is 28, divorced, and has one 13 year old son who goes to a city high school. She lives with her mother, with whom she shares household expenses. Her mother owns her own home.  
 
Tania Lorena is a merchant. She runs a variety store and has done this for 4 years, working from Sunday to Sunday. She learned sewing when she was 12 years old and now she also works in a a shop for half a day from Monday through Saturday. She divides her time between the two jobs. The money from the loan will be invested in buying more items for her variety store. Her goal is to have her own vehicle.

loans.use: To buy Omnilife products and variety store products

loans.name: Coquetas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Coquetas" se encuentra ubicado en Guerrero en el Estado de México, las clientas decidieron ponerse este nombre porque son muy alegres, está integrado por 9 clientas en el se encuentra la señora María Luisa B. M., quien es la tesorera, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, ella platica que ha sido muy difícil sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que con el sueldo que su esposo obtiene como albañil no alcanza para los gastos de la casa, en ocasiones se queda sin trabajo lo que ha complicado que tenga una estabilidad económica siendo que en su localidad las fuentes de trabajo son muy escasas, y por ello la decidió poner una pequeña tienda en su casa para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, con el crédito invertirá en mercancía, su deseo es que sus hijos puedan continuar con sus estudios y algún día ser unos excelentes profesionista algo que ella no pudo cumplir y desea ofrecerles.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Coquetas" (The Flirts) and is located in Guerrero, in the state of Mexico.  These clients decided to give their group this name because they are all very cheerful women.  The group has nine members, including María Luisa B. M. who is the group's treasurer.

María is 33 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She tells us that it has been very difficult to get her children ahead in life because the wage that her husband earns as a construction worker doesn't cover all their household expenses.  Sometimes he has no work which has made it difficult to achieve financial stability since sources of work are very scarce in their town.  For this reason, María decided to set up a small store in her home in order to support her husband with their expenses.  She will invest her loan in buying more merchandise.  Her wish is for her children to continue in their studies and for them to become good professionals some day.  This was something that she could not achieve for herself but an opportunity that she would really like to offer her children.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her store

loans.name: Marcia Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Marcia C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive por la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales, su rica gastronomía y sus bellos paisajes.

La Señora. Marcia tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 6 y sus dos últimos que son gemelos de 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en su propia unidad de taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

Doña Marcia es estilista, actividad que aprendió estudiando y ya son 14 años que ejerce esta profesión  y es toda una profesional, tiene un local propio y labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tientes y otros productos que necesita para su gabinete, es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta porque tiene muy buenas amigas. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marcia C. is a member of the Mujeres de Combate (Women of Battle) communal bank. She lives in the Baños parish. This parish is known for its thermal waters, its delicious gastronomy, and its beautiful scenery.

Marcia is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  Her first child is six years old and goes to school.  The two youngest are three year old twins.  Her husband is a driver, and he works with his own taxi.  They do not have their own house, so they live in a relative’s house.

Marcia is a stylist, and she learned this profession by studying.  She has been practicing this profession for 14 years.  She is a complete professional, and she has her own place of business.  She works every day from eight in the morning until six in the evening.

She will use the money from the loan to buy dyes and other products that she needs for her cabinet.  This is her second loan in the communal bank.  She likes the bank because she has a lot of good friends.  

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy dyes and other beauty products

loans.name: Amada Andrea

texts.es:
La Señora Amada O. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive por el sector de San José que pertenece a la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales, su rica gastronomía y sus bellos paisajes.

Doña Amanda tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 13, 12, 10 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Amanda es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de calzado, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes y sin un horario fijo, su calzado lo vende recorriendo la ciudad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de zapatos para niño. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ms. Amanda O. is a member of the “Mujeres de Combate” Communal Bank.  She lives in the sector of San José that belongs to the parish of Baños.  This parish is known for its thermal waters, rich gastronomy, and beautiful landscapes.

Amanda is 34 years old.  She is married and has 4 children ages 13, 12, 10, and 8.  Her first two children study at the “colegio” (school) and the last two attend a small school in the sector.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  They do not own their own home so they rent.  

Amanda is a tradeswoman who sells shoes.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  She works from Monday to Friday but does not have set hours.  She travels throughout the city selling her shoes.  

This is her second loan with the communal bank which she joined at the invitation of a friend.  She will use the money form the loan to buys children’s shoes.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes.

loans.name: Rosa Fabiola

texts.es:
La Señorita. Rosa Z. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive por el sector de Huizhil que  pertenece a la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales, su rica gastronomía y sus bellos paisajes.

La Señorita. Rosa tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive haciéndole compañía a su abuelita, quien tiene casa propia.
 
Nuestra socia de lunes a viernes se dedica a sus estudios universitarios encontrándose en su segundo año de Economía y los fines de semana labora con su padre como cajera de un local de venta de mariscos, trabaja de de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, trabaja allí por 3 años.

Es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un computador para sus estudios. Su meta es culminar sus estudios y poder viajar.
texts.en:
Miss Rosa Z. is a member of the "Mujeres de Combate" (Fighting Women) community bank.  She lives in Huizhil, in Baños parish.  This parish is known for its hot springs, its fine food and its beautiful landscape.

Rosa is 19 years old.  She is single and lives with her grandmother, who owns her own home, keeping her company.

From Monday to Friday, Rosa studies at university.  She is in her second year of a degree in economics.  On weekends, she works with her father as a cashier in a place that sells seafood.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  She has worked there for 3 years.

This is the third loan that Rosa has had through her community bank.  She was invited to join by her mom.  Rosa will use her loan money to buy a computer for her studies.  Her goal is to finish her studies and travel.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Maria Amada

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el caserío San Eduardo, una zona rural a 12 km D. la localidad D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización  D. aves D. corral (pavos), los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro D. su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Esta actividad la realiza hace tres años, actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Adicionalmente ofrece en su domicilio la venta D. diversas golosinas. 

María desea ampliar su negocio alimento balanceado D. modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y comprar productos como golosinas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old, married, and lives together with her family in the small village of San Eduardo, in a rural area 12km from the town of TambogranD., an agricultural district located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

María's business is raising and selling poultry (turkeys).  She raises the birds on her property.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the general public and the traders who visit her area.  She has been in this business for three years.  She currently has a regular and loyal customer base.  She also sells candy from her home.

María would like to expand her business and buy balanced animal feed so that she can increase her sales.  She would also like to buy products such as candy.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed and products for her small grocery store

loans.name: Loeung's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of four members who will use their portion of the loan for various activities. Loeung H. is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. She is 42 years old and married.  She sells scarves door-to-door where she can earn a profit to help support her family. Her husband is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he grows rice. Now Mrs. Loeung wants to start a new business and is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Deth's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Deth is the leader of this group loan. She has been selected by five members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to  improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Deth was born in 1962. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Young, is a construction worker. They have two children who are seamstresses in garment factories.

Currently, she faces an obstacle because her roof is leaking. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Deth is requesting a loan to buy zinc to build a new roof.

loans.use: To buy zinc to build a new roof

loans.name: Pas' Group

texts.en:
The five people who make up this group loan have selected Mrs. Pas to become the group leader. They will use their portions of the loan in various ways to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Pas is 44 years old. She is a vegetable seller in the local marK.. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Pas is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables. 

Her husband, Mr. Ret, is a palm juice collector who can earn some money from selling palm sugar. They support six children. Two are employed in garment factories; one is a palm juice collector, and the others are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman who lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Jose, who is 60 years old, is retired but helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children. Anita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,500, which she added to her own capital, helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion and savings. Anita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people who have selected Mrs. Meas to be the village bank leader. All will use their portions of the loan to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Meas was born in 1961. She and her husband, Mr. Soa, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land where they grow rice. They sell some part of the rice yield and the other part they keep to support their family. She is the mother of seven children: Three are seamstresses in garment factories, one is employed in a private company, another is a student, and the others are farmers.  

Now she has a problem because her house does not have a television. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Meas is seeking a loan to buy a television and a battery for using it.

loans.use: To buy a television and battery for using

loans.name: Mrs. Poeurk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who make up a village bank loan have selected Mrs. Poeurk to become the village bank leader. They will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Poeurk was born in 1972. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are employed in garment factories, while the youngest one is 11 years old.
 
She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells some part of the rice and the other part of the rice she keeps to supports her famiL.. Her husband, Mr. Kan, is a battery seller. 

Since her husband’s business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to achieve this purpose, Mrs. Poeurk is applying for a loan to buy more batteries to resell.

loans.use: To buy more batteries for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Prak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people make up a village bank loan that will be used by each to improve their family's standard of living. They have selected Mrs. Prak to be the village bank president. 

Mrs. Prak was born in 1958 and she is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. She is a chicken breeder and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she can plant rice. She sells some part of the rice yield and the other part she keeps to support her family. 

Although she tries to work hard, she can earn only a little income. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Prak is seeking a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Mrs. Tuy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuy is the village bank president who has been selected by the seventeen people who make up this village bank loA.. Each will use their portion of the loA. to improve their family's standard of livI.. She owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to earn some income to support her family. 

Since her business is gettI. on well, Mrs. Tuy wants to expand. She is applyI. for a loA. to buy more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Lot, is a chicken breeder and a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where he grows rice. He sells part of the rice yield and the other part is used to support his family. Through these activities, they support three children, two of whom are attendI. local public school, while the other is a student.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Khot

texts.en:
Khot S. is a 39-year-old woman who lives with other family members in Siem Reap Province. She feeds a few pigs and chickens to earn a living. Her husband is a rice farmer, who earns a profit of approximately $5 each day to support his family. They have four children; three are single and one is married. 

Presently, one of her kids is a fish seller and is using a bicycle as a vehicle. It is very hard for her child to sell this way. To encourage her child, Khot S. is taking her loan to buy a motorbike to pick up fish to sell.

Khot S. and her cute child are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to pick up fish to sell

loans.name: Pa

texts.en: Mrs. Pa is a chicken breeder and a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells some of her rice yield and the rest is used to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vanny Sen, is a construction worker and fisherman. Both try to work hard, but they can earn only a meager income. Mrs. Pa is applying for a loan to buy a cow to raise to start a new business. She is the mother of a child who is 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Mrs. La was born in 1980 and she is a food seller selling vegetables and meat in her local village to earn a little income to support her family while her husband, Mr. Nat, is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where he can plant rice. He sells part of the rice harvest and uses the rest to support his family. 

Mrs. La has some problems because their field has infertile soil. So to improve production rice, Mrs. La is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are studying in local public school, while the smallest one is a 3-year-old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Chom

texts.en:
Mrs. Chom was born in 1950 and she cuts palm tree fronds to sell to make roofs while her husband, Mr. Chhan, is a village vice-chief and a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where he grows rice. He sells some of the rice harvest and keeps the rest to support his family. 

Mrs. Chom's husband’s workplace is far away from their home. So  Mrs. Chom is applying fO. a loan to buy a new motorcycle as transportation. She is the mother of three children who are seamstresses in garment factories.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok is a married woman who was born in 1969. She and her husband, Mr. Sokun, are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land where they can grow rice. They sell part of the harvested rice and keep the rest to feed their family. Her husband is a duck egg middleman at local market where he can also earn some income to support his family.

Mrs. Sok has some problems because her field has infertile soil. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sok is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. She is the mother of seven children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin is married to Mr. Sey, and they have four children, one of whom is a grocery seller who can only earn a little income, while another one is a finder of customers for taxis, and the other two are attending local public school. She is a Khmer cake seller at the local school where she can earn a little income to support her family. Her husband is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where he plants rice. He sells part of the harvested rice and keeps the rest to feed his family. 

It is time for growing rice in the dry season, and that is why she is asking for a loan. To improve rice production, Mrs. Sin is asking for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun M. is a 41-year-old who has been in the farming business for many years. Besides doing farming, she is good at making baskets at home to sell for extra income. She is a married mother of two children who are students in the local public school. She has a partner in her husband who helps her to plant crops as well as being a firewood seller, in and around Kompong Chhnang province. 

Moeun M. and all their family members still live in an old house that is frequently broken and their living conditions have been affected. To solve this problem, Moeun M. will take her loan to purchase wooden poles to build a new house. Moeun M. and her young child appear in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase wooden poles to build a new house.

loans.name: Poeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Poeun, who is married to Mr. Sarim, was born in 1983. They have three children who are too young to work or study. Mrs. Poeun is a seamstress in a garment factory where she can earn a low salary to support her family while her husband is a driver who also gets a low salary to support his family. Beside being a driver he is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to support his family. 

Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a meager income. So Mrs. Poeun is asking for a loan to buy a cow to raise to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Hiek

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiek who was born in 1964 is married to Mr. Vai. They have three children, who are studying in local public school and helping out in their parents’ businesses. Mrs. Hiek is a pig breeder who can earn some income to support her family while her husband is a farmer who owns a 5-hectare plot of land where he grows rice.He sells part of the harvest and keeps the rest to feed his family.  He also owns a harvest machine and a threshing machine. 

Presently, Mrs. Hiek faces an obstacle because her harvest machine is broken. So Mrs. Hiek is applying for a loan to fix her harvest machine. With any remainder of the loan she is going to buy more gasoline to fill the harvest machine and the threshing machine for renting out to other farmers. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To fix her harvest machine

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo is 54 years old and she is married to Mr. Kun. They have three children: One is a boat-taxi driver, one is a farmer, and the other is studying in local public school. 

Mrs. Keo is a Khmer cake maker, while her husband is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he can plant rice. He sells part of the rice yield and the other part he keeps to support his family. 

She wants to start a new business, so she needs capital to support it. To achieve this purpose, Mrs. Keo is asking for a loan to buy a mother pig for breeding. With the rest of the loan she is going to buy gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide. 

Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a mother pig

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung S. is a 26-year-old woman who works as a sewing worker at the garment factory and has a regular salary monthly. 

Her husband makes a daily profit by selling lotus flowers in the busy market. 

Recently, her husband has been offered lotus flowers in bulk from his supplier at a low price, and then he can sell them for a profit. Kung S. wishes to assist her husband’s business, but her current savings is not enough to make it possible. In order to overcome this obstacle, Kung S. has decided to use her loan to purchase lotus flowers in bulk for resale.

loans.use: To purchase lotus flowers in bulk for resale

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoem was born in 1962 and she is a pig breeder who can earn some profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. K., is a farming laborer and a farmer who owns a 3.5-hectare plot of land where he grows rice. He sells part of the rice yield and the other part he keeps to support his family. This couple supports three children, two of whom are boat-taxi drivers, while the other is attending local public school.

In the rice field, there is a problem because the field is far away from the irrigation system. So to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Chhoem is applying for a loan to buy gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide. 

Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget is the mother of five children, three of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the others are too small to work or study. She was born in 1986 and is married to Mr. Mouv. 

She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells part of rice yield and the other part she keeps to support her family.

Her husband is a construction worker and a fisherman. 

They get only a little income although they try to work a lot. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Nget is asking for a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Uk's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who have selected Mrs. U. to be the group leader. They will use their portions of the loan to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. U. was born in 1968. She is married to Mr. Sin, and they have a child who is enrolled in local public school. 

Her husband is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where he grows rice. He sells part of the rice yield and the other part he keeps to support his family. 

She is a silk weaver who can earn some profit from selling silk cloth to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to achieve this purpose, Mrs. U. is seeking a loan to buy more silk for weaving.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Choeng's Group

texts.en:
The four people who make up the group loan will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Choeng is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1968. She is a weaver who can earn some money selling silk cloth to support her family while her husband, Mr. Phal, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. He sells part of his harvest and keeps the rest to feed his family. 

Mrs. Choeng has some problems because her field has infertile soil and  a lot of insects. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Choeng would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a student. The small one is only 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Chak L., age 38, is married woman who is a professional teacher in the province of Kompong Chhnang. Chak L. has been working in this sector since 1990, and she always receives a formal salary every month from this occupation. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a painter in his community. The couple is blessed with three school-aged kids who are enrolled in school. 

In addition, she also has a single sister, a tailor, who still lives with Chak L.. Presently, her sister faces some problem with her sewing business because her sewing machine is broken down. Therefore, Chak L. made the decision to borrow some funds to help her sister's business by purchasing a new sewing machine to replace the broken one and buying some cloth.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine to replace the broken one and some cloth

loans.name: Mrs. Keo Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people who have selected Mrs. Keo to become the village bank president. Each will use their portion of the loan to improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Keo was born in 1946 and is married to Mr. KhU.; both of them are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land where they grow both rice and vegetables to sell to support their family. They have three children, two of whom are employed in private companies, and the other is a student. 

Now Mrs. Keo has a problem because her child needs some money to pay school fees. Mrs. Keo is applying for a loan to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: The four people who make up this group loan have selected Mrs. Sophy to become the group leader. They will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Sophy was born in 1967. She is a Khmer cake maker and a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Seng, is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a 1.2-hectare plot of land where he can plant rice. He sells part of the harvest and keeps the rest to feed his family. Recently, Mrs. Sophy faces an obstacle because her husband’s workplace is far away from their home. So Mrs. Sophy is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for his transportation.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Everyone knows that fish is the main vital fresh food, especially for families who depend on fishing and fish selling, from the local river, where the best place for sheltering is. Huon Y., one of those people, currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. 

Huon Y. is a humble mother who has been blessed with four kids. Two of them are working, in Phnom Penh, as sewing workers. Because her house is too old and so narrow, it is not comfortable for her whole family to live in. To deal with this problem, Huon Y. would like to request a loan from Kiva to build a new, bigger wooden house.

loans.use: To build a new, bigger wooden house

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay A. is from the village of Muñoz West. He is 34 years old. Jay is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jay owns & operates motorcycle services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to community members. He also keeps busy buying and selling scrap and waste materials in their community. Jay has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jay joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell. Jay is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair the motorcycle used in the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jay from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair the motorcycle used in recycling and transport

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan P. is a 40-year-old married woman who currently lives in Kompong Cham province. To earn a living, she grows rice on her own farmland which she inherited from her grandparents many years ago. Phan P. typically generates around $1.50 USD a profit. She can plant her crop at least two times per year, in the rainy season and the dry season. Her husband also assists her in the same business as a rice farmer.

 In a short time, she will hold a wedding ceremony for her son, but her personal savings are insufficient.  Phan P. is asking for loan to hold the wedding ceremony which will be coming soon.

loans.use: To hold a wedding ceremony for her son

loans.name: Mrs. Ma Leap Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma Leap is the village bank president who has been selected by the thirteen members of this village bank loan. They will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their family's standard of living. 

Mrs. Ma Leap was born in 1981. She is a knitter and a tailor who can earn some income to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sokuntha, is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a plot of land where he can grow rice to feed his family. Presently, Mrs. Ma Leap needs some money because she wants to buy a cow to raise to start a new business. So Mrs. Ma Leap would like to request a loan to add to her savings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang R., 28, is married to Put Saroun, 29, who is a local farmer. Seang R. is good at making bamboo baskets at home to sell at the market as well as helping her husband to grow rice on their farmland.
