The couple has given birth to three children; two of them are studying at the local school. Presently, she wants to raise a few piglets behind her house for additional income, but she lacks money to do that. That is why Seang R. would like to ask for a loan from lenders of HKL's partner, Kiva.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding purposes

loans.name: Mrs. Sareth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people who will use their portiO. of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Sareth is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a pig breeder and a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she plants rice to feed her family while her husband, Mr. Nel, is a constructiO. worker and a basket maker. 

Since her pig breeding is getting O. well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Sareth is applying for a loan to buy a mother pig. With any remainder of the loan she is going to buy more constructiO. supplies for her husband to use. This couple is raising two children who both are enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy a mother pig

loans.name: Phang

texts.en: Phang S. has been weaving baskets at home for many years in Kompong Chhnang province. She and her husband work together from home making baskets, and her regular clients come directly to their house to buy them. In order to increase her income, Phang S. has applied for a loan to buy several piglets for feeding, which she will sell when they are big enough.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok M. is married and has one child.  She and her family live along National Road Number Six, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Sok and her husband are vegetable farmers. She is requesting a loan for $600 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mr. Soeun S. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Sreyhoeun Tep, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 17 kilometers outside of the city. They have three sons and one daughter. Two attend school and the other two are still young. 

Mr. Soeun S. is a barber. His wife is a garment factory worker. In March 2010, he applied for his first loan to purchase a second-hand motorbike, but it's not strong and breaks down sometimes. That’s why he wants to sell the old motorbike and add to money from the loan to purchase a new motorcycle. He will also use a part of the loan to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To purchase a  new motorbike for commuting and build a restroom for family use

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina lives in a small city called Kot Radha Kishan which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and is famous for its agriculture and dairy industry. She lives there in a single-room brick house with her family in the area of Judgewala. She came here 20 years ago. She is 45 years old, married to M. H., and has 4 sons. Due to financial reasons she is unable to educate her children.  

Her husband is a talented man, operates a musical band and entertains people at their functions by offering musical performances. People contact him at different functions such as marriage ceremonies and birthday parties, etc.  He is the only breadwinner in the family. For this reason, his growth in business is absolutely necessary for them to improve financially. 

That’s why Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a musical instrument (guitar) to improve the quality of his band which should earn him better profits. Robina is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and do her household works. 

She is hopeful that an investment will put her husband’s business in more profitable position which will result in better financial conditions for her family. 
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To buy a musical instrument (guitar)

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang S. (in the photo) is 27 and her husband Mr. Tep Rith is 27 years old. They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have one young son. 

Samnang is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a car repairman. Samnang hopes to supplement their incomes with a new business, renting out space in her house to garment factory workers because her house is located near the garment factory. Hence she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to build rooms to rent out.

loans.use: To build rooms to rent out

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past 29 years. Altantsesteg used to work for someone selling clothes at a stall with her husband, but began her own business in 2010. She prepares food at home and sells it at the market. Her husband and children help her with the cooking and preparation. 

Her business has become more stable due to the increase in regular customers. In the beginning she started her business with a working capital of 40,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 300,000 MNT. She wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She says, "I would like to expand my business and give a good education to my children." She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to buy groceries and food ingredients for her cooking business.

loans.use: To buy groceries and food ingredients

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mrs. Son L. (in the photo), 56, is a widow with three children--one son and two daughters. Two are married and another one assists her mother in her business. The family lives in a village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. 

Son sells Cambodian cake in her village. She buys ingredients from the market and makes cake on her own. She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law for commuting

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeun S. (shown in the photo) asked for a prior Kiva loan. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of $700 to continue her farming business and purchase weaving materials for her daughters' weaving business.

Khoeun and her husband live on an island located 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have eight children--four sons and four daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home; one son is a construction worker; two weave silk at home and the other three attend school.

loans.use: To use for farming and buy weaving materials for her children’s weaving business

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Mrs. Phum K. is 52 years old and her husband Mr. Ruos Sok is 53 years old. They have been married since 1979 and have seven children--six sons and one daughter. Three are married and live separately; two are construction workers and another one assists his parents in the business. The family is living in a small village on National Road Number Two about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phum and her husband are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village where they live. Phum is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a cow. She will use the cow to plow her rice farmland.  

Photo: Mrs. Phum K. is at home, was not at the farm

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw material for making bread

loans.name: Laura Concepción

texts.es: Laura Concepción M. D. P. D. 51 años D. edad, resiD. en el  municipio D. Armenia, en el departamento D. Sonsonate, ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual se dedica a su propio negocio, el cual está ubicado en su casa D. habitación, mismo lugar en el que vive junto a su esposo. La señora Laura posee una panadería, en la cual se dedica a trabajar desD. hace 16 años atrás, es por esta razón que ella es muy conocida en la zona ya que siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora la cual entrega todos los pedidos a tiempo y que cuenta con muy buenos estándares D. calidad. Laura solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, miel, azúcar y otros ingredientes más, los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración del pan. Laura trabaja arduamente día con día para poder contar con una mejor estabilidad económica junto a su esposo, y así también poder mejorar el negocio, el cual ha sido muy rentable para ella.
texts.en:
Laura Concepción M. D. P. is 51 years old and lives in the town of Armenia, in Sonsonate department.  She is a very responsible and hard-working person who owns her own business.  Her business is located in her home where she lives with her husband.

Laura has a bakery that she has run for 16 years.  She is very well known in her area since she is a hard-working woman who delivers all her orders on time and who makes her goods to very high-quality standards.

Laura is requesting a loan to buy flour, butter, honey, sugar and other ingredients that she needs to make her bread.  Laura works hard every day to proviD. herself and her husband with better financial stability and to improve her business which has been very profitable for her.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and other ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Natividad De Las Mercedes

texts.es: Natividad D. Las Mercedes B. D. L. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad. Natividad es viuda, por lo que ha tenido que trabajar muy duro por salir adelante junto a su hijo el cual ahora es mayor D. edad y se dedica a trabajar. Natividad  posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual es D. mucha ayuda para su hogar y la mayoría D. gastos D. la casa. Natividad solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con la capacidad D. poder comprar granos básicos, verduras, pan, golosinas y otros productos más los cuales son muy solicitados en el negocio. Ella alberga la esperanza que gracias a este préstamo  pueda mejorar sus ganancias y D. esta manera poder contar con una vida mejor en la cual estén suplidas D. todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Natividad D. Las Mercedes B. D. L., age 60, lives in Ciudad Arce in the La Libertad department.  Natividad is a widow, and she has had to work very hard to get ahead together with her son.  He is now an adult, and he works.

Natividad has a store where she sells perishable products.  The store is a big help for her household and most of the household expenses.

Natividad is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy basic grains, vegetables, bread, sweets, and other products that are requested a lot in the business.    

She harbors the hope that, thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve her earnings.  That way she will be able to have a better life in which she has all of her necessities.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and basic grains to sell

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana has been living in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishen for past 15 years. It is known for its dairy industry. Her house contains a single room and is located in the area named Judgewala. 

She is married to M. S. who is in the animal-sales business. He purchases animals when they are young, raises them and sells them for a  profit. He has been in this business for many years and has a good number of clients in his area. Most of his clients are butchers who buy animals from him to sell as meat. 

Rehana has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works in a factory while the others are getting their education by attending local schools.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy some goats for the further expansion of his business. 

Rehana is hopeful that after investing loan in his business, her husband will be able to expand his business and earn more profit. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rehana.

loans.use: To buy goats for animal-sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy premium ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de frutas, golosinas y sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy perishable goods to sell.

loans.name: Juana Delta

texts.es: Juana Delta M. R. de 52 años de edad, reside en la colonia Las Margaritas, en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su hijo quien se dedica a trabajar y a ayudarle económicamente a su madre. Juana posee una tienda de productos perecederos y así mismo un taller de corte y confección en el cual se encarga de realizar prendas de vestir para hombres, mujeres y niños. Así mismo ella elabora ropa sin pedido previo los cuales los comercializa con las personas de la zona, esto con el fin de obtener otras fuentes de ingresos. Juana solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder obtener el dinero necesario para poder comprar hilo, telas, botones y todo lo relacionado a la materia prima que ella utiliza para realizar su trabajo. Ella desea poder brindarle una mejor ayuda económica a su hijo, es por ello que trabaja tanto por obtener ganancias extras.
texts.en: 52 year old Juana lives in the Las Margaritas community in the San Salvador department. She lives there with her son who works and helps his mother financially. Juana has a perishable goods store and also a tailoring workshop where she makes clothes to order for men, women, and children. She also makes clothes that haven't been ordered and sells them to people in the area, which gives her another source of income. Juana is requesting a loan so that she will have the money she needs to buy thread, fabric, buttons, and all the raw materials that she uses in her work. She wants to be able to give more financial support to her son, and this is why she works so hard to get some extra income.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

location.town: colonia Las Margaritas, departamento de San Salvad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new scissors, tables, and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fabric and buttons to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pupusas

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Mrs. Eleuteria, 51, is married and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City,  Misamis Occidental. When she learned about Paglaum MPC, she became a member in 2009 so that she could get help to set up her business. She used her first loan of PHP 3,000 to buy one piglet and this is how she started her hog-raising business.

She is grateful to God that her hog-raising business has done very well and she has buyers already. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and more piglets. She also wants to build a concrete piggery for her pigs.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy feed and more piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of more perfumes to sell

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi is a married man with three children, two boys and one girl, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. His wife makes dumplings for sale from home to her neighbours. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees, food and clothing for his family.

Kahindi operates a retail shop business, selling maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice to his neighbours and passersby.  He plans to pay back this loan well so that he can qualify for more loans in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he plans to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. His long term plan is to own a "posho" (cornmeal) milling machine for a business so that he can support his family in terms of their basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Nicolen

texts.en:
Nicolen V. is 52 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. He is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Nicolen is engaged in the retail sector running a general store. Despite close competition in the market he was able to manage his business for more than two years and earned a monthly net income of 3500 PHP. The secret of his success came from being hard-working and maintaining his good customer care.

In 2010, Nicolen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicolen is requesting his 1st loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new stock for his existing business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new stock for the store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46, she is married and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Mary has two children. She found ways to survive, and opened a “sari-sari” (general store) with a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in October 2005. She was able to manage the business successfully; in fact, it covers her daily consumption needs and also her child's allowance.

 Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store. She will be happy if she sees her child finish school.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Mrs. Flor has enjoyed more than five years of association with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, a partner through thick and thin for her business. Her primary source of income is dressmaking . It’s a daily challenge for her to submit her loan payments on time, but this has now become a habit. 

Flor is 57 years old, married, and has four children. She tells us with priD. that she is able to nurture all her children well. Finishing a degree was far out of sight for her and she only reached the fourth year of high school. But she’s happy that she was able to send her children to school. She has applied to Paglaum MPC for a loan of PHP 14,900. With this loan she will purchase additional fabrics & materials for dressmaking. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials for dressmaking

loans.name: Besta

texts.en: Besta is currently in a business of selling mixed goods. She is 40 years old, married to a farmer, with six children and none of them goes to school. Besta took out a loan to stock more mixed goods to sell. With extra profits from her business, Besta hopes to pay to have her children go to  school in the future.

loans.use: stock more mixed goods to sell

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Mr. Gerry L. is 38 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. He is blessed with one child. Gerry is a farmer and own a little parcel of land. Gerry cultivates the land for gardening & it has also become his own primary activity. It began as a back-yard gardening project and eventually led to selling a few of his garden vegetables during market day. 

He's thankful to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for providing them with financial assistance in the past. He is now applying for PHP 10,000 to buy farm pesticides and fertilizers for his garden. 

He has many plans for the future. One of his dreams is that someday, he will be the one supplying vegetables in the market.


About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm pesticides and fertilizers for his garden

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is 46 years old and married to Muse who contributes to the family income. She has seven children who are all dependents. She has been  farming on her own piece of land. She has been in the business for a period of six months with an income of about KES. 5,000 per month.

Mary has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use it to buy seedlings for her farm. 

She hopes to expand her retail shop and grow drought-resistant crops in the future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Mrs. Helen R. is 40 years old, widowed, and lives at Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She has four children. It is not easy for Helen to be a mother & father at the same time. Determination and hard work are what Mrs. R. believes in. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to avail herself of its loan facilities. The co-op teaches their members to have a "livelihood project" or business in order to become productive and self-reliant. 

Helen has accessed loans several times. Some were used for the payment of tuition fees for her children. Now, she is applying for PHP 2,000 to buy additional goods for sale for her sari-sari store business.

She would be contented & happy as a mother if she sees all her children become successful in their chosen career.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant. She is 38 years old, a widow with 4 children, and all of them go to school. Regina borrowed a loan to stock more foods to sell in the restaurant. With extra profits from the business, Regina hopes to pay her children in school in the future.

loans.use: stock more foods  to sell in the restaurant

loans.name: Mrs. Chuob Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people make up this village bank loan and will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. Mrs. Chuob is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She was born in 1955. She and her husband, Mr. Sunney, are farmers who own a plot of land where they can grow rice. They sell part of their harvest and keep the rest to feed their family. 

Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a little income. So  Mrs. Chuob is applying for a loan to buy a piglet for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy a piglet

loans.name: Dama Karisa

texts.en:
Dama Karisa R. is 49 years old. She is married to Kombe and they have two children. Dama runs a food kiosk and has been in this business for the last two years. 

This being her second loan from KADET LTD, she plans to purchase rice, cereals, cooking oil, flour and potatoes  for business. The surplus income that will be generated from the business will be directed into the expansion of her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and give back to the community through creation of employment.

loans.use: purchase rice, cereals, cooking oil, flour and potatoes

loans.name: Mr. Sopheak Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's standard of living. Mr. Sopheak is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. He was born in 1975. He is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he grows rice. He sells part of the harvest and keeps the rest to feed his family. His wife, Mrs. Uk, is a seamstress in a garment factory where she gets a low salary to help support her family. 

Presently, Mr. Sopheak has a problem because his wife’s workplace is far away fR. his house. So Mr. Sopheak is asking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for his wife's transportation. He is a father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school. The younger one is a 5-year-old.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia B. is from the village of Muñoz West. She is 50 years old. Nelia is married and has five children. To make a living, Nelia owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Nelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Alimaa, 46, is widowed and lives with her two children in Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband passed away two years ago, so she must take care of her two children by herself. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent,  on a small plot of land that they own. Both of her children attend a local secondary school. 

Alimaa graduated from a vocational school as a tailor in 1986 and worked at a local clothing factory for six years. She began operating her own business in 1993. In the beginning she made clothes at home, however in 2008 she began to rent a workplace in a bigger trading center. Since she began her own business she was able to save enough money to buy the land they currently own. She wants to have her own workshop in the future so that she can save money on rent. 

Alimaa is a hard-working and brave person who says, "I want my two children to get a good education so they can live without any difficulties in the future." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a stitching machine for her business.

loans.use: To buy a stitching machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice for sale

loans.name: Penina Upendo

texts.en:
Penina Upendo M. is 25 years old. She is married to Charles and they have three children. Penina runs a vegetable kiosk. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and she is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase onions, carrots, potatoes and cabbage for sale. 

The anticipated income will be directed into the expansion of her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: purchase onions, carrots, potatoes and cabbage

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: K. is currently in the business of selling goods. She is 27 years old, married to a farmer, and has five children. Four of them go to school. K. took out a loan to stock more goods to sell. With extra profits from her business, K. hopes to pay her children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane B. is from the village of Villaramos. She is 33 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children.

Baby Jane owns and operates a general store, selling different kinds of products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Baby Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for store renovation.

Baby Jane is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan K. is a married man with seven children; five are school-going children while two have graduated from school. He operates a local brew business made from palm tree sap, selling from home to his neighbors. 

He decided to join Yehu because of its accessibility for sustainable financial services. With the Kshs 40,000 he plans to purchase construction supplies for his house. 

In the future, he hopes to expand his business and establish another business to earn more profit to meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies for his house

loans.name: Sagapsapan's Group

texts.en:
Lina S. lives in the village of Banonong. She is 58 years old and leads a two-person loan group that receives funding from PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan for their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Lina is a widow and has 3 adult children. She makes a living by selling barbecue in the local community. She has been in this business for more than 2 years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid seven previous loans from PMPC, and used each of them as additional capital for her business.

Lina and fellow her loan group member are each applying for a new loan of 12,000 PHP. Lina will buy additional fresh meats and spices for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fresh meat and spices for barbecue vending

loans.name: Lois

texts.en: D. is currently in the business of selling onions and tomatoes. She is 35 years old, and married to a farmer. They have four children--three of them go to school. D. is taking a loan to stock more onions and tomatoes to sell. In the future she hopes to build a house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Consolatrix

texts.en:
Consolatrix B. is from the village of Pob. Manukan. She is 56 years old. Consolatrix is married with two adult-aged children. Consolatrix owns and operates a specialized retail store (sari-sari store). The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Consolatrix has had her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Consolatrix joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her sari-sari store. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Biibaatar

texts.en:
Biibaatar is a 34-year-old bright man. He is married and has a two-year-old son who attends kindergarten. His family lives in a small house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working in clothing sales for over 10 years. His wife helps support the family by running the business together at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. 

He started the business in 2001 with two stalls at Narantuul, with working capital of 500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks). He sells children’s clothing imported from Ereen, a border city of China. As a result of his hard work, he managed to acquire two more stalls in 2005, which he had been renting over the past few years. Meanwhile his wife was raising their child; two stalls were operated by him and the other two by a salesperson. Today, his working capital is around 9,000,000 MNT. Moreover, he managed to build a new small house in 2008 with the business profits. 

Biibaatar is requesting a loan of 3,700,000 MNT to purchase more merchandise to increase the business. He also wants to expand the business in another indoor market called Dunjingaraw. He wishes to move into an apartment where his family can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora B. is from the village of Muñoz West. She is 54 years old and single. She provides manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 34 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Leonora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provided. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase materials needed for the business. This will be her eighth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her extended family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem S. is a 41-year-old woman, married to Chin Peaktra, age 43. They earn a living by growing rice on the farmland that they purchased years ago. The couple lives with seven children, two of them whom are employed and consistently contribute to cover the family's expenses. Yem S. plans to use her loan, plus her savings, to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland, which is a good location for farming. The loan will provide her with an additional asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Muhudin

texts.en:
Muhudin is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while the other is still too young. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

He has operated a real estate business for the past four years. His potential customers are tenants and others in the neighboring community. Muhudin faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to expand his real estate business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase cement and blocks to renovate his rental houses. He decided to join Yehu because it offers sustainable financial services to small scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase cement and blocks to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Njagi

texts.en:
Njagi M. is 33 years old and married to Rose Wairimu who is a housewife. He has two children, aged five and two years old. He has run his farm, where he grows french beans, for eight years with an income of about KES. 20,000 per month. 

This is Njagi's second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan on time. He intends to use the loan to buy farm supplies and lease more land for a higher profit. 

He hopes to expand his farm and improve the living standard of his children

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and lease more land for a higher profit.

loans.name: Kansenene Group

texts.en: John is a member of Kansenene United Traders where each member guarantees the others' loans. He needs a loan to purchase fresh food such as irish and sweet potatoes to sell. He lives in Fort Portal Uganda and is married with eight children. The youngest is 15 years old. John has been dealing in fresh foods for two years and has already grown his profits. His future plan is to set up at least six stalls in different markets.

loans.use: Purchase fresh produce for sale.

loans.name: Horm

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Cham, Horm S. is a 29 year-old married woman and mother of three young children. She and her children are shown in the photograph. Horm S. has made a living for many years by cultivating a rice crop on her farmland. Her husband is a recycling seller--he travels around his village to buy used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The products which he buys are leftover electricity wires, cans, and bottles. Horm S. is looking for a loan to purchase a good piece of farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a single man who rents a house that has neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expense are personal expenses and helping his extended family. 

He has operated a milk business for the past one year, selling retail and door-to-door to his neighbours. In addition he also operates a vegetable stall. Daniel faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase fresh milk from farmers to resell to retailers. He decided to join Yehu because of the availability of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase fresh milk from farmers to sell to retailers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: N. is currently in the business of selling fish. She is 35 years old, and married to a pastor. They have five children, all of whom go to school. N. is taking a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: Stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gala

texts.en: Gala is currently in a business of selling fish. She is 28 years old, married to a farmer, and has 3 children who go to school. Gala asked for a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with two school-aged children. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a tuk tuk business (for public transport means) for the past five years.. In addition, he also operates a video business.  Mohamed faces a major challenge of tuk tuk maintenance, as it is very costly. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase another tuk tuk for public transport. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loans.

loans.use: To purchase another tuk tuk for public transport.

loans.name: Dum

texts.en: Dum P. is a 33 year-old woman who is employed as a sewing worker in the garment industry. She has been working in her job since 2006 and has a  monthly salary.  Her husband works in construction. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their two kids. Both of the kids attend school. Dum P. is concerned that the fence at her house is getting old and some parts are broken. Because her savings are not enough to repair her fence, Dum P. would like to apply for loan to install a new fence and to mend some parts which are broken.

loans.use: To install a new fence and to mend some parts which are broken.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a married man with one child who is too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

He has operated a second-hand clothes business for the past two months, selling in a shop and from door-to-door.  In addition, he also operates a chips shop. Enock faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business.  He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase a bundle of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Judy Njeri

texts.en:
Judy is a 41-year old single mother of three children, aged 12, 10 and 7 years. She has been keeping livestock on her own piece of land and selling them later at a profit.   She has been doing this for 18 years, with an income of approximately KES.10,000 per  month.


This is her first loan from KADET LTD., and she intends to use it to buy animal feed and farm inputs. She hopes to expand her business by buying a dairy cow for milk production in order to help her improve the living standard of her family and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and farm inputs

loans.name: Besta

texts.en:
Besta is currently in a business of selling beans, onions and sugar.  She is 32 years old, married to a farmer, and has six children.  Five of them go to school. 
Besta asked for a loan to stock more beans, onions and sugar to sell. She hopes to pay for her children's school fees and expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more beans, onions and sugar.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 38 year old businessman.  He is married and has two children, aged 3 and 7.  He sells vehicle spare parts to better his family’s living standard.  He also works as a mechanic to get more income.  He has been running his business for five years and has employed one person. He was introduced to Faulu Kenya by his friend.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money.  He is also able to get loans easily from Faulu Kenya.  
He hopes to replenish his business stock so as to increase his income, grow the business and employ more people.  He has requested 70, 000kes to buy more spare parts.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for his wife.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan T. is 38 years old and has been selling fish and vegetables on foot in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia. She gets the fish from her husband’s fishing or buys them from other fishermen. Mrs. Nan T. is married to Saren, age 48, who works at fishing in and around the local lakes.  He also plants lotus flowers in his own pond. They have two  kids who are learning in school. 
Mrs. Nan T. is concerned that she has to walk to sell her fish, and she dreams of having a vehicle to pick up her items.  Nan T. would like a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her transportation.
